Title: Data Warehouse Analyst
Description:
Job Number:J0222-2134Job Title:Data Warehouse AnalystJob Type:Permanent FT SupportBargaining Unit:FT SupportSchool/Department:Finance & Business DevelopmentCampus/Location:Progress CampusPay Range:$41.96 - $48.66/HourPay Band:Support KHours/Week:40Shift Schedule:Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 5:00 pmDate Posted:July 5, 2022Closing Date:July 28, 2022Centennial College recognizes and affirms Diversity, Equity and Inclusion and Indigenous ways of knowing as central to the vibrancy and uniqueness of its learning and working academic mission. We strongly encourage applications from members of Indigenous communities and all equity-deserving groups including Women, Racialized, Persons with Disabilities, and LGBTQ+ communities.
We also recognize that Centennial is situated on the Treaty Lands of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and pay tribute to their legacy as well as that of all First Peoples that have been and remain present here in Toronto. We recognize that First Peoples come from sovereign Nations and that part of understanding our responsibilities of residing on this territory are understanding the true history, circumstances and legacy of the Treaties signed here (such as the Toronto Purchase, Robinson-Huron Treaty and Williams Treaties) and including pre-contact Treaties and Agreements between sovereign Nations and that all peoples in this area are therefore Treaty people with obligations and responsibilities to all our relations.Position SummaryReporting to the DevOps Manager, the Data Warehouse Analyst will work with clients across the College to analyze, plan, organize, and optimize analytic databases and applications. They will work to improve the IT department’s understanding of what data would help the College meet business goals and plans. Consequently, the Data Warehouse Analyst will gather those requirements and engage in expanding the data warehouse and its capabilities by extending and/or improving the data warehouse architecture and other external data sources. The primary focus is to design and administer the ETL (Extract, Transform, Load).The incumbent is an expert in all aspects of BI starting with the collection and transformation of detailed data elements, through to helping users access and use the information in the data warehouse. The Data Warehouse Analyst will assist IT Analysts in developing the presentation layer(s) and providing specialized reporting views. In addition, the incumbent will provide support to data analytic clients by providing features/data elements for advanced analysis such as forecasting and predictions.The incumbent will keep up to date with the rapid advancements being made in BI systems and will help both ITS and business users understand how the new technologies can be applied to move the College forward in planning and monitoring goals and objectives.****ResponsibilitiesProject Leadership and Support

Leads the development and maintenance of data warehouses and Operational Data Stores (ODS), Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and creates new or expanded data stores to support new requirements.
Leads multifunctional teams to ensure data warehouse projects are aligned with other IT projects and meet user requirements.
Resolves issues related to service requests or production problems.
Collaborates with business users to understand and collect business requirements.
Supports the coaching and training of staff on processes, procedures, and appropriate work practices, as needed.
Provides both technical and general direction to junior team members.

Planning and Analysis

Plans projects to develop new data sources, new data feeds, new data stores and new tools for end users.
Analyzes current reporting applications and/or data warehouses through review of documentation and interviews with clients.
Follows and is compliant with company policies and procedures and the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.
Prepares or assists with feasibility studies, requirements definitions (e.g., Source to Target Mappings), conceptual design documents, work plans, systems design, implementation designs, system and program specifications, and system and client documentation.
Defines testing requirements.
Troubleshoots production systems.
Researches and has a deep understanding of sources of data.
Develops and manages implementation of data/code fixes for defects utilizing the Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) process.
Monitors data warehouses load performance and data quality on a regular basis or for month-end and works with Information Technology (IT) staff to improve both performance and quality.
Consults with managers in requesting business units to determine project timelines, and where necessary, develops project plans to complete data warehouse requests

Design, Development and Administration

Manage architecture, applications, systems and reporting services
Extract, Transfer Load (ETL): Design end to end processes to extract, transfer and load data from the Banner ERP solution and other sources into the custom and ODS data marts.
Co-ordinate the design and develop efficient workflow processes to automate ETL events
Identifying, troubleshooting and reporting application performance and outages
Fine tuning and performance enhancement throughout all ETL processes through data cleansing recommendations, coding and redesigning of data models
Performing general monitoring of core and external applications linked to the Decision Support and Reporting support systems.
Develops SQL queries, shell scripts, PL/SQL stored procedures, and reports, using customer requirements and documents, in accordance with established criteria and standards.
Designs, integrates, tests, maintains, and supports automated reports delivered through Cognos or other technologies, as required.
Designs and executes the moving of data from one environment to another by using Imports or SQL queries.
Prepares operational documentation for the system users and support teams according to established departmental and divisional standards.
Contributes to team effort by completing assigned tasks and supporting other team members.
Creates program design specifications in accordance with established criteria and standards
Provide the quality assurance on promoting applications and services received from program analysts through development environment and test to production server application according to college approved promotion policies, procedures and change management routines.

Qualifications/Experience

Minimum four (4) year Degree in Computer Science or a related field
Minimum five (5) years in Data Warehouse Design and Architecture, including extensive experience designing, implementing and supporting data model and data warehouse projects.
Strong understanding of the ERP product and the flow of information in context of data warehousing
Strong understanding of Oracle technologies including Oracle ODI and PL/SQL programming
Data Warehouse Design (Kimball and/or Inmon methodologies) or similar certification a plus
Demonstrated experience in:
Relational Database Management System (RDBMS).
A business analyst and/or systems analyst in IT role together with experience in managing customer relationships and project coordination/project management.
Technology process mapping, business process mapping and workflow.
Executing quality assurance best practice and procedures for information systems and services
Technical Project Leadership
Oracle PL/SQL programming
Extract-Transform-Load Tools and Techniques (Oracle Database Integrator or similar)
Data modeling toolsets such as ERWIN or ER Studio Data Architect
Internet Information Servers (IIS), WINDOWS, Linux/UNIX
Shell scripting
Additional assets:
Knowledge of Oracle database architecture
Hyper Text Mark-up Language (HTML), Dynamic Hyper Text Mark-up Language (DHTML)
JAVA, Extended Mark-up Language (XML), Groovy, Shell Scripting, Python
APACHE, Simple Mail Transfer
Protocol (SMTP)
Collaboration and facilitation skills to consult with diverse stakeholders and facilitate discussions among stakeholders with different interests
Demonstrated leadership skills
Strong judgement, organizational skills and ability to be flexible/adaptable,
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Apply online: www.centennialcollege.ca/careers
Proof of credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post secondary institutions and/or their foreign equivalents will be required at the time of job offer.
When applying, your cover letter and résumé must include examples that reflect all of the requested skills and qualifications and must be submitted online by July 28, 2022 at 11:59 PM EST. Please quote Job ID J0222-2134.Misrepresentation of applicant information will be grounds for your exclusion from the competition or for dismissal should you subsequently be hired for the position. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Bill Gosling Outsourcing is committed to the career development of our people. If you are interested in joining a company with modern facilities and a team environment, click on the “Apply” button to get started!
 


   The Business Analyst works with the organizations to help improve our processes and systems. They conduct research and analysis in order to come up with solutions to business problems and help to introduce these systems to businesses and their clients.
 

 Champion the development and identification of opportunities for business improvement and efficiencies based on the IIBA Business Analysis Book of Knowledge (BABOK) and the Analytics Framework Tools/Techniques/Methodology to identify business needs that align with business objectives, and the corporate vision
 Facilitate Business Process design, re-engineering mapping, gap analysis, audit evaluation, and automation of complex data structures using BPMN 2.0 standard for ISO 18295 and ISO 27001 compliance
 Liaison among stakeholders (e.g. operations, human resources, finance etc.) in order to understand the structure, policies, and operations of the organization, and to determine business requirements at a strategic, operational and tactical level
 Elicit business, solution and transition requirements and proactively seek clarification of requirements, articulate the need for change, facilitate and manage direction for process, people and data analysis
 Analyze client organization's industry and competitive position providing input into Business Strategies for applications of new technologies through research from various sources e.g. google, financial sources, Gartner etc.
 Create and present reports / KPI/Solution overview to all levels of the organization
 Set up and maintain the Process Requirements Matrices
 Work with stakeholders and other team members to define metrics and performance goals for the application
 Assist in translating requirements into use cases and expected results for product, performance, and user acceptance testing Requirements
 Champion company core values and other company programs
 Other duties as assigned




    Education
  

    Completed Post-Secondary education in a related field
  

    Preferably a University Degree and/or Technical or Business Degree
  


    Experience
  

    3+ years of experience with SQL, (or equivalent), Microsoft Excel, and statistical analysis tools (e.g. Power BI).
  

    3+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analysis role.
  

    5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analysis role, ISO implementations and audit would be an asset
  

    Knowledge of BPMN 2.0 process modeling standard
  

    Must display fine attention to detail - successfully completes tasks requiring deep attention to a high volume of detailed information with the ability to build quality process into job functions
  


    Certificates, Licenses, & Registration:
  

    Certified Business Analysis Professional Designation, Business Analyst Certification from an accredited College or Business Degree with the required (CBAP) experience
  


    Reports to: Director of Analytics

Title: Risk Analyst Intern/Co-op (8 MONTH)
Description:
All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer. 
Why TD?
 TD's Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.
 A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That's our unique and inclusive culture.



Department Overview

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.
 Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles, and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:

 Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
 Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation
 Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

 For TD Bank Group to grow profitably, it must selectively take and manage risks. TD recognizes that a strong risk culture and approach to risk management is fundamental to our success.  TD's risk management approach is comprehensive and proactive and combines experience and specialized knowledge of individual business segments, risk professionals, and the corporate oversight functions. It is based on enabling TD's business to understand their risks and developing the policies, processes and controls required to manage these risks appropriately in line with the Bank's strategy and risk appetite.



Job Description

    Risk Management is a key Corporate Function supporting the front-line businesses within TD with over 1,800 employees in offices in Canada, United States, UK and Singapore. We partner internally with many different areas of TD as well as our business partners to ensure we exceed our client's expectations, and employees to focus on a positive employee experience. We work externally with regulators to align with industry standards and benchmark ourselves against best practices.
    
 As a student part of the TD Risk Management Co-op program you will have the opportunity to join different development workshops, seminars and lunch and learns. We will provide you the necessary tools, resources and guidance to achieve both business and personal goals.
   


Job Requirements


Currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree majoring in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Financial Analysis, Risk Management, Computer Science or equivalent
 Must be enrolled in an undergraduate degree with the intent of going back to school at of the start of your work term
 Familiarity with SAS
 Relational database SQL skills for data mining, extraction and statistical analysis.
 Strong excel Advanced MS Excel and MS Access for data analysis (Pivot, Filter, Formulas, Vlookup, VBA)
 Dedicated, detail oriented, and an ability to propose creative solutions
 Written & verbal communication skills
 Quick learner
 High degree of personal initiative


 Skills that are not required, but considered an asset:

 Knowledge of Financial Industry/Risk Management/Retail Credit products
 Experience using Business Intelligence Reporting tools such as SAP Business Objects, Cognos or Tableau
 Microsoft Visio would be an asset
 Knowledge of R and HIVE
 Knowledge of Basel Capital Frameworks
 Quality Center (HP ALM) Testing tool
 MS Project




Additional Information

Please note that this is a general posting. If you are selected for an interview, more information regarding which business group and the specific job duties will be provided.

 This position is a 8-month work term and will commence Sept 6th – April 28th, 2023
 Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).
 We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.
 TD is committed to providing you with the best candidate experience and internship in these unique circumstances. As such, work location and start dates are subject to change.

 LOCATION TD requires employees to reside in Canada where the role is located. Successful candidates are expected to arrange relocation to one of our Toronto offices in a hybrid model (1-3 days per week in office).  HOURS Monday-Friday, standard business hours



Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: S&OP Analyst
Description:
PROLLENIUM - RESHAPING THE AESTHETIC EXPERIENCE ™
Prollenium is a Canadian-based company focused exclusively on the research and manufacturing of medical devices. Our commitment to product development, innovative research and manufacturing means we will continue to revolutionize the medical aesthetics market while maintaining to be one of the leading manufacturers of HA fillers, worldwide.
Prollenium provides competitive compensation, benefits and development opportunities.
As a member of the Operations team, the S&OP Analyst will gather and analyze numerous data sets and provide analytical support and insight to improve the operational effectiveness. You will liaise with various other departments across the organization to support the coordination of analytical efforts including Manufacturing, Logistics and Inventory Control. You will develop key performance analytics for the management team, develop new reporting methods and continuously improve existing tools and models which provide additional visibility on operational and sales performance. In addition, you will support existing partner and program tasks, document creation and ad-hoc reporting amongst other tasks.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities:

Coordinate and lead cross functional efforts that identify key improvement opportunities, then design a plan of action, execute the plan, report the results, and ensure sustainability.


Build and manage tools and processes that support key objectives such as demand, capacity, and supply planning, inventory modeling, service and revenue forecasting, plan optimization, and gap analysis. Develop advanced analytical tools and reporting to support the entire S&OP process.


Create, monitor, and maintain S&OP metrics and key performance indicators, identifying potential risks and opportunities.
Consolidate and analyze demand and supply information for the operational, tactical, and strategic plans, and use data to drive on-time delivery, establish lead times, inventory turns, and maximizing revenue.
Work with operations to optimize production efficiencies with a focus on cycle times, batch sizes, working capital, and shift strategies.
Once the plan is in place, help facilitate cross-functional communication between all levels of the organization to support new product launches. This might include line extensions, promotions, discontinuations, or other actions all based upon decision-making modeling of process flow, inventory levels, costs of manufacturing, and distribution and transportation.
Determine target inventory and planning method policies for major products with input from business and segment leaders.
Support decision-making and the improvement of critical processes including Production Scheduling, Materials Planning, Manufacturing, Inventory Planning, Capacity Planning, Transportation Planning, and Distribution Resource Planning.
Drive resolution to operational issues, while keeping cross-functional partners aware of supply and service issues by providing facts.
Responsible for system integrity relative to planning parameters (safety stock parameters, planning time fence, lot size).
Build and manage tools and processes that support key objectives such as demand, capacity, and supply planning, inventory modeling, service and revenue forecasting, plan optimization, and gap analysis. Develop advanced analytical tools and reporting to support the entire S&OP process.
Other duties as required, including ad hoc reporting and special projects

Qualifications and Experience Requirements: 

University degree or college diploma in a relevant discipline
3+ years experience with data analysis, reporting and problem solving (including extracting information from Salesforce and ERP Systems)
Advanced level of knowledge in MS Excel special functions (i.e.VLOOKUP & Pivot Table), VBA and experience of MS Office Suit, Excel, and Access, PowerPoint
An in-depth understanding of data reporting tools and methods
Good knowledge transferring skills with an ability to present findings in a logical & relevant format (verbal & written)
Good understanding of object-oriented databases and logical relationships
Strong mathematical and statistical skills (data sets, variance, hypothesis testing)
Expert attention to details and accuracy, able to conduct root-cause investigations
Strong business modelling and information management skills
Hands on and detail oriented and able to work well with multiple priorities
Strong time management and ability to meet deadlines
Results oriented with a sense of urgency
Customer oriented – strives to exceed internal customer expectations
Clear consistent and reliable communicator
Comfortable in a fast-paced dynamic environment
Ability to use data to help form decisions from a management and other internal stakeholders’ perspective

Prollenium Medical Technologies is an equal opportunity employer that will make reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities, including accessible formats of materials and/or processes to enable suitable access to those in need. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, disability, ancestry, marital status, medical condition or any protected category prohibited by local, provincial or federal laws.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: From $60,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care
Life insurance
Paid time off
RRSP match
Vision care

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Richmond Hill, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

AEC / DEP or Skilled Trade Certificate (preferred)

Experience:

Data analytics: 3 years (required)

Title: Channel Sales Programs Analyst
Description:
Summary


      Posted: Jul 15, 2022
     

      Weekly Hours: 
      37.5


      Role Number:
      200397354



     The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it! Apple’s Sales organization generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This in turn, enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people all over the world. Our sales team, is in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers. We grow Apple’s enterprise business with our amazing products and powerful ecosystem, and we've partnered with experts in enterprise around the world to change the way people work. The ideal candidate is highly analytical, creative, and possesses strong listening skills and a consistent record of accomplishments. This position requires the ability to perform complex business analysis and build out tools and processes to track offers and identify standard methodologies.
    








Key Qualifications




Innovative and strategic thinking to aggregate data, build reports and automate communication.
Ability to prioritize between short-terms goals and long-term priorities with a consistent track record of exercising solid organizational and planning skills.
Advanced data analytics skills including modeling, interpreting and presenting data to focus on what's most impactful.
Proven record of working cross-functionally with a variety of partners including sales, finance, sales operations, contracts, logistics, and supply chain teams.
Desire to push yourself and others to drive better outcomes and continuous improvements.










Description



       We are seeking a Programs Analyst to support end-to-end development and implementation of channel programs and ongoing management processes. You display exceptional communication with cross-functional business partners to provide deep and insightful analysis. You are highly innovative and adept at driving continuous process improvements. In this role you will support the commercial reseller programs end-to-end process including planning, forecasting, reporting and analyzing performance of activities. Establish a thorough understanding of all Apple's processes that impact channel partners including partner onboarding, seller incentive programs, order management, new product introductions, and inventory management. - Develop sophisticated automated reporting for channel sales team to identify trends and key metrics. - Partner with sales leadership to standardize quarterly business reviews, track partner progress against plans, and develop governance tools for program metrics. - Collaborate with key strategic partners to measure business process performance, to identify improvement opportunities, and to measure the impact of improvement projects. - Create a standard set of reporting to monitor and govern channel reseller programs. - Create and document standard operating procedures for program administration. - Gather feedback, improve program processes and measure improvement impact. - Become an expert cross functionally on channel program processes.
      








Education & Experience



       Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education
      








Additional Requirements

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
We like to say that we find solutions for the everyday stuff. We’re problem solvers. We’re an engaged team that works together, and for those that work here they say we’re also like family.  Vallen is a leading provider of indirect industrial supplies – all those materials that are not part of the products our customers manufacture, and our goal is to make our customers operations run smoothly so they can focus on the core of their business.  Vallen is a member of Vallen North America and is one of Canada’s leading industrial distribution companies headquartered in Edmonton, Alberta.


 Responsible for maintaining correct customer pricing records in SXe database, assist on monthly agreement reviews, and prepare reports and other documents for internal pricing review and strategy.


Major Responsibilities:



Work with branches and sales team to improve margin
Work with Pricing Manager to produce a detailed pricing strategy
Maintain pricing records for all Vallen customers
Maintain market and sales data where necessary
Prepare reports and other documents for distribution to sales team
Trouble shoot pricing issues and inaccuracies
Maintain Pricing Tab of Intranet
Manage life cycle of deals
Manage, prepare and submit monthly vendor rebates


 
Education, Training & Experience



Minimum 1-3 years of related experience, preferable in a Sales/Distribution environment 
College/University Diploma preferred (Business, and/or Sales & Marketing, or Technical focus an asseet)
Knowledge of Microsoft Office
Strong Microsoft Excel skills – particularly database tools
Knowledge of BI Tools is considered an asset

What’s it like working at Vallen? Upon joining our team, you will become part of a supportive, family-oriented culture where you will be led by a president who fully believes in having an open-door policy. Your suggestions will be heard, and your hard work will be rewarded.  Vallen is an equal opportunity employer committed to increasing diversity in our workforce. We welcome applications from qualified persons in underrepresented ethnic, racial and cultural groups and from people with disabilities.  We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Joseph Ribkoff designs classic and contemporary garments for fashion-forward women with a youthful state of mind. Each one of our carefully tailored pieces offers the effortless fashion, fit, and quality that we’ve been synonymous with. 

 Over the years, the brand has blossomed into a touchstone for timeless, youthful style. Driven by a passion that has never ceased to propel our company’s vision, Joseph Ribkoff has been an ally to women, dressing them with flair and perfect fit for over 65 years. From our quality and distinctly designed products to our unwavering commitment to retail partners, Joseph Ribkoff’s values resonate in everything we do and create. 

 Today, his legacy lives on through the work of a devoted, talented team operating from the four corners of the world. Sold in over 60 international markets, Joseph Ribkoff is a global emblem of quality and elegance. 

 Montreal Corporate Head Office, where most of their employees are based, offers career opportunities in Design, Operations, Sales, Marketing, Finance, IT and HR as well as in the Production and Warehousing facilities. 


Objective:
 Reporting to the Director of BI & Applications, the Master Data Analyst creates, update, and assure the data consistency in the ERP & PLM systems. Data accuracy is a key aspect of this role as well as to support the end user in all their requests. Engaging with business partners and participating in projects/initiatives, the Master data Analyst play a key role in establishing the procedures and governance to be followed when it come to master data management. 


Responsibilities:


Create and update master data in ERP systems & PLM such as, new style of garments, colors and fabric content, vendor accounts, employee accounts, specific customer accounts, pricing, etc.
Participate in day-to-day data cleansing activities.
Create, modify, and enhance new and on-going consistency test reports
Contribute to ideas and actions towards continuous improvement of processes within Master Data and Data Quality
Create, maintain, and communicate documentation around master data processes.
Responsible to support the end users by answering and analyzing all requests related to data received through a ticket system, in a timely manner.
Maintain good communication with business partners regarding master data requests and proactively pursue all information required for the timely completion of work assignments
Discuss with departments stakeholders to prioritize the work to do.

Qualification and Skills:


DEC in data management, business, or related field
3-4 years of experience in data management or pertinent related work experience
Strong MS Office knowledge (Excel, Word, Outlook)
Experience with Microsoft D365, an asset
Strong written and oral communication skills are required
Ability to build solid relationships with various departments
Strong analytical and systems thinking skills
Ability to think critically and find solutions
Detail oriented & organized
Bilingual, French & English
 Joseph Ribkoff is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

Title: Business Analyst (6 month contract)
Description:
Global Enterprise Services (GES) is accountable for the operation of Canada's two systemically important clearing houses (CDS and CDCC) and, as a shared service organization for TMX, it also provides services that support TMX businesses in meeting their objectives. In this regard, GES provides the Firm's Technology, Information Security, Enterprise Risk Management, Integrated Operations, Project Management, Vendor management and Innovation services.
 

   Key Accountabilities:
 



     Collaborate with Business and IT stakeholders to gather, confirm and document functional and non-functional requirements
   


     Serve as TMX business activities and systems usage expert, for both business partners and internal teams.
   


     Participate in activities required for the approval and prioritization of change requests with the business partner and the Head of Client Technical Delivery;
   


     Provide assistance to project stakeholders of project communication and end-user training
   


     Define and document requirements into business requirements document (BRD)
   


     Provide assistance to review QA test cases and scenarios
   


     Provide BA support to Development and QA teams during the build and test cycles
   


     Participate in testing, reporting on results, ensuring quality and adherence to the business requirements
   


     Estimate own BA work effort and provide regular status reports on progress
   


     Carries out any other related task assigned by his immediate superior
   



 Skills:
 




     Comfortable working with a variety of technical applications and software, and gathering business requirements and mapping processes
   


     Detail focused with an ability to work with large volumes of data, keep organized, and identify discrepancies and/or inconsistencies
   


     Able to work with subject matter experts to collect detail and map out business processes
   


     Flexible to take on a variety of tasks, organized to keep track, and diligent to ensure completion to meet deadlines
   


     Ability to work independently with minimal direction and supervision, and capable of prioritizing tasks
   


     An aptitude for identifying inefficiencies and proposing processes improvements
   


     Good interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively across teams and with varying personalities
   


     Ability to explain complex processes in simple terms and comfortable preparing presentations and presenting
   


     An understanding of risk tolerance and appetite
   


     Reliable and ethical, respecting customers’ confidentiality at all times
   


     Willingness and ability to adapt to a changing environment and responsibilities
   



 Experience/Education:
 




     University degree, preferably in Engineering/Technology
   


     or equivalent
   


     Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office, Google Suite
   


     (Gmail, Docs, Slides & Sheets)
   


     Advanced knowledge of Excel / Google Sheets (Vlookups,
   


     Hlookups, conditional formatting, if/and/or statements, index/match, concatenate, transpose, filtering, sum product, etc.)
   


     Experience / involvement in large delivery projects
   


     Experience troubleshooting software defects involving clients (i.e.. Following up and managing client issues as reported, taking care of internal teams to resolve issues, etc.)
   


     Knowledge of the Canadian Capital Markets financial industry, CDS and/or CDS systems is an asset
   


     Experience developing training materials and facilitating training with end-users is an asset
   


     Experience with SQL scripts is an asset
   


     Bilingual with the ability to speak, write and read in both French and English is an asset

Title: Sr Financial Analyst - Sr Data Analyst
Description:
Your Opportunity:
 Activity & Workload Consulting & Analytics is a service of Health Professions Strategy & Practice (HPSP). Activity and Workload information supports unit, program, and organizational decision-making, planning and benchmarking (Operational Best Practice), when used with other clinical, financial and statistical data. The Senior Financial Analyst position is responsible for analyzing the information requirements of the patient care managers and designing and delivering complex management reports and analysis from a variety of databases, with emphasis on patient activity and workload data.
 Description: 
As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will be responsible for reporting and interpreting complex financial and statistical information to support senior level management, operating portfolios and external reporting requirements. Your responsibilities include in-depth analysis; reporting related to financial statements and other cyclical activity; responding to audit requests; development, input, maintenance and monitoring of departmental budgets; policy, procedure and internal controls interpretation, development and enhancement; and coaching and mentoring to Financial Analysts and entry level staff members.


Classification: Sr Financial Analyst
 Union: AUPE GSS
 Unit and Program: Activity and Workload Consulting and Analytics, Health Professions Strategy & Practice
 Primary Location: IBM Building
 Multi-Site: Not Applicable

 Hours per Shift: 7.75
 Length of Shift in weeks: 2
 Shifts per cycle: 10
 Shift Pattern: Days
 Days Off: Saturday/Sunday
 Minimum Salary: $41.00
 Maximum Salary: $49.60
 Vehicle Requirement: Not Applicable

 Required Qualifications: 
Completion of post-secondary diploma in Accounting or related field (e.g. Economics, Statistics).
 Additional Required Qualifications: 
Post-secondary diploma in computer systems or information technology, from a recognized technical institute. Proficiency in EPIC Clarity, Caboodle & Access Data models.
 Preferred Qualifications: 
Training in Tableau reports. Knowledge of acute care clinical data is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst, Revenue Assurance
Description:
Req Id: 383289

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.

 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 The Finance Team manages the performance and risk profile of Bell, ensuring the needs of customers, investors and employees are balanced with long-term business success. We work closely with internal and external stakeholders to develop and execute plans that help the company achieve its strategic objectives and ensure financial sustainability.
 The Revenue Assurance (“RA”) Team is part of Finance, and its mandate is to identify, recover and prevent revenue leakage across the Wireless Market. The Revenue Assurance team is focused on improving profitability by maximizing revenues and minimizing costs. The Service Revenue team focuses on service revenue reporting and forecasting. This role will be cross functional with both the RA and Service Revenue team; collaborating with a wide variety of stakeholders such as Product Management, Marketing, Finance, IT, Operations, Customer Care, etc…
 The objectives of the role are:

 Develop scripts and queries to extract data from our various systems and manipulate into a meaningful format
 Identify and assess potential revenue leakage opportunities and perform diagnostics/process mapping to determine project feasibility
 Act as a change agent to improve billing accuracy and participate in new service/feature introduction to mitigate revenue leakage
 Review business processes and workflows. Documenting these with the objective of pinpointing gaps.
 Extract Elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of stakeholders, customers and end users.
 Collaborate with Project Sponsors to determine project scope, vision and improve operational processes.
 Conduct interviews to gather customer requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
 Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team 
Influence the development and implementation of business processes/infrastructure from Sales to Collection.
 Lead cross-functional resources on multiple, concurrent revenue recovery projects.


 Critical Qualifications/ Competencies:

 Expertise in SAS/SQL, Teradata, COGNOS and Microstrategy with the ability to create queries in each of these databases and experience handling large datasets (50M+ rows)
 Predictive modelling in R or other statistical packages
 Proven Project Management skills (3+ years experience)
 Established track record in the co-ordination of cross functional and virtual teams
 Strong capacity to analyze and design workflows
 Business analysis and analytics experience
 Strong documentation skills and attention to detail.
 Demonstrated ability to conduct effective research, analyze data and communicate results
 Strong communication/presentation skills
 Indepth knowledge of Order and Billing systems (SingleView, NM1, OneBill, UsageView)
 Excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills
 Results oriented, curious and pro-active
 Strong sense of urgency and willingness to take initiative

 Educational level required: 

University degree in business, Computer Science, Statistics, Analytics or IT

 Years of experience required: 

3 years Project Management, Business Analyst, experience analyzing revenue and related drivers


 Specific experience: 

Knowledge of SAS/SQL
 PMP Certification or Business Analyst Certificate an asset
 Expertise in Microsoft Office Suite
 Previous experience working as a Business Analyst for software development projects
 Finance exposure

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  About MUFG Investor Services:
 MUFG Investor Services provides asset servicing solutions to the global investment management industry. Leveraging the financial and intellectual capital of MUFG – one of the largest banks in the world with $2.8 trillion in assets – we provide clients access to a range of leading solutions from fund administration, middle-office outsourcing, custody, foreign exchange, trustee services and depository to securities lending and other banking services.
 With a diverse and dynamic network of offices across the globe, MUFG Investor Services provides challenging and rewarding careers. We achieve this by offering continuous learning and development, collaborative team work environment, promotion of work-life integration, and exposure to a wide variety of work.
 Imagine your future at MUFG Investor Services where you can grow professionally, in a diverse and inclusive workplace that rewards your contribution.
 #LI-Hybrid



 Job Description
  Reporting to the Executive Director, Head of Data Engineering & Strategy, this is a unique opportunity to join a dynamic, fast-growing organization in Financial Services.  You Will

 Mine data from multiple sources and develop data processing pipelines
 Explore source databases and tables to develop source to target mapping that meets our data requirements
 Work with business analysts, data engineers and product owners to gain a deeper understanding of business processes and data requirements
 Define and manage meta-data standards, data mappings and the data dictionary
 Define data quality rules, validation checks and automated cleansing methods for data pipelines
 Use data analysis, aggregation, imputation and visualization techniques on large datasets to gain business insight.
 Implement and test business logic, transformations and calculations to support data pipelines
 Enrich datasets through feature engineering
 Develop data and statistical analysis to look for trends, patterns and outliers in historical data




 Qualifications
  You Have:

 3+ years of professional experience
 3+ years experience with Python
 2+ years experience working with data and statistical analysis techniques
 2+ years experience with data-related process controls, data-mapping, and ETL processes and tools
 2+ years experience working with relational databases (eg. Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL) and SQL
 Experience using AWS Data Lake formation a plus
 Experience in Accounting or financial services technical experience a plus

 Additional Information
  At MUFG Investor Services, we are exceptionally proud of our approach to Hybrid Working. It enables the flexibility to thrive from wherever our employees work and, stay connected to their team and our culture. When we make Hybrid Working plans, we get to know the individual and pride ourselves in underpinning all our decisions with fairness and consistency.
 MUFG Investor Services provides all of its employees with an extremely attractive compensation package. In addition to base salary, there is a group medical insurance scheme, group pension scheme, reimbursement of professional subscriptions, paid holidays and assistance towards gym memberships.
 We thank all candidates for applying; however, only those proceeding to the interview stage will be contacted. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only to provide an accessible candidate experience.
 MUFG is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Systems Analyst – Database, Data Modelling Analyst
Description:
SYSTEMS ANALYST – DATABASE,  DATA MODELLING ANALYST 

POSITION SUMMARY:  The Database Analyst works as part of a team to provide  project development and operational support services across  the entire region. Functionally, this is a hybrid role that  performs Analysis-Programming-Database and Data Modelling  services. The Analyst level typically works under the direct  guidance of the Sr. Solutions Architect or Database Architect,  for work task definition and prioritization.   WHAT YOU’LL DO:  
Performs development services as required for major  and minor projects following standard development  lifecycle methodologies (ex, preparation of clearly  articulated requirements documents), under the general  guidance of management or senior staff.  
Performs system support and sustainment activities for  assigned areas of responsibility. Works as part of a  regional support model to resolve production issues  (typically level 2 or comparable) in conjunction with  established service level agreement (SLA) targets. Includes productive use of our service  management ticketing application.  
Works as part of a cross-functional distributed support team to take care of one or more  assigned applications or technologies (i.e. MS Business Intelligence Toolset). Support  services could include application lifecycle management, technical support, end user support,  and issue management.  
Create documentation that includes intermediate to complex diagrams (swim lane diagrams,  flowcharts, process flow diagrams).  
Troubleshooting data gaps or anomalies with SMEs (Subject Matter Experts).  
Work with Database Architect to design, model and implement solutions. Includes creation of  appropriate documentation while obtaining customer signoff and approvals.  
Participate and contribute to meetings, workshops and design sessions.  
Store and provision data securely in our Data Warehouse, following established standards and  best practices.  
Participates in the investigation and technical recommendations for assigned areas of  responsibility  
Shared responsibility for technology change management as an ad-hoc member of the  Change Advisory Board (CAB)  
Responsible for work assignments prioritization, scheduling, and issues management for  assigned technologies  
Shared responsibility for the upkeep and safeguarding of production systems in partnership  with the Service team.

Location: Windsor, ON  (Hybrid – Onsite and remote  work)

2 

WE VALUE: 

Healthcare IT related experience an asset 
OTHER CONDITIONS: 

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
We know what it means to put the customer first—our business is built upon a tradition of exceptional, individualized customer service. Our employees experience the excitement and satisfaction that comes from working for a successful, expanding company where every team member makes a difference and where initiative and hard work are valued and rewarded. We are confident that if you choose to work at ROBINSON, you will be taking your first steps towards a challenging, profitable, and satisfying career. 

 Working within the Pricing & Product Data department and reporting to the Team Lead, Pricing, the Pricing Analyst will work alongside their peers to help maintain a centralized pricing model across our branch network. The Pricing Analyst will drive revenue and margin improvements by working to continually improve the company's pricing structure through ongoing analysis of transactions, data, and market information. 


What you will do:


Work closely with the sales team to identify and deliver pricing opportunities that drive sales and improve margin
Maintain customer data including new customer updates, re-assignment of contracts and pricing information, and categorization
Review and correct pricing discrepancies or product issues that arise
Conduct analysis on sell groups for pricing matrix set-up using multiple reporting tools including Excel
Maintain sell matrices and contracts consistent with company's pricing philosophy
Provide ongoing pricing analytics/benchmarks that enable proactive management of the pricing process
Review price overrides and low margin sales
Generate pricing reports for management

About you:


Post secondary degree or diploma in business or equivalent
Minimum 3 years working in a similar position
Solid understanding and experience in pricing, supervising others, sales, and/or operations
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills with the ability to manipulate large amounts of data
60 WPM word processing capability
Strong analytics skills with strategic and critical thinking capabilities
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and facilitation skills
Attention to detail, detail oriented, and well organized
Be able/willing to travel occasionally within western Canada for branch meetings
Previous experience using Epicore Eclipse ERP is a definite asset

ROBINSON offers a competitive total rewards program including:


An inclusive, fun and family-oriented work environment
Monthly bonus opportunities
Annual Profit Share
Paid Wellness Days
RRSP Matching
Employee Referral Bonus
Sabbatical Leave
Tuition reimbursement
Comprehensive benefits
Training and promotion opportunities
 Family-owned ROBINSON is a leading Canadian distributor of plumbing, heating, electrical, and lighting products. Today, the company serves customers in the construction industry and retail home improvement markets through a network of 32 distribution warehouses and showrooms in British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, and Ontario. ROBINSON’s reputation as a growing company with a customer-service oriented culture continues to attract and retain top quality people and has earned it Platinum status among Canada’s Best Managed Companies. ROBINSON is committed to a diverse, inclusive, and respectful workplace. We strive to foster an environment that values our differences and believe in giving back to the communities in which we live and work. 

 ROBINSON will provide accommodation for candidates with disabilities throughout our interview and selection process. 

 Thank you to all interested candidates, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Junior Business Analyst – HRIS
Description:
Job Summary
Do you thrive in a fast-paced technical services environment and have strong attention to detail? Are you eager to have a career where you are encouraged and supported to meet your potential and goals?
StarGarden Corp. is the developer of a comprehensive suite of Human Resource Management software for the public sector. StarGarden Corp. is looking to add to our Client Services - Implementation and Support Team.
StarGarden will train the right candidate in the support and implementation requirements. You will work as part of the Implementation and Support team and with Account Management to align client HR requirements with our HRIS capability and ensure delivery to specification. StarGarden believes in continual improvement and advancement and supports our employees in this with ongoing training and opportunities.
As a Junior Business Analyst – HRIS your focus will be on delivering support to our clients and assisting the Implementation Team with client projects. This role involves a myriad of responsibilities, including:

Daily Client support: logging, researching and responding to client issues
Assist Project Managers and Business Analysts with client configuration, data entry and testing
Creating or updating client user and product documentation
Creating and delivering training to clients/users
Testing client custom functionality and core product changes
Analysis and documentation of client business requirements
Follow up as requested by Account Managemen; creation and delivery of regular Client Account reports
Identify gaps between client requirements and opportunities to solve their problem

Essential Criteria

4-year degree (preferably in Management Information Systems and Human Resources)
Excellent oral and written communication skills


Highly personable with consultative skills
A problem solver with a keen eye for detail, eager to use analytical skills to resolve issues
A track record of meeting deadlines and deliverables with a high degree of accuracy
Strong analytical skills and the ability to make recommendations and decisions
Flexible, ambitious, and adaptable to change
Motivated self-starter committed to achieving results, including a strong sense of ownership and assertively following through to resolution under limited supervision
Ability to manage simultaneous tasks or projects, strong time management skills

Desired Technical Skills

HR Generalist
Knowledge of payroll
HRIS implementation
Client support and training
Knowledge of business structure
HR workflow and business process documentation
Familiarity or experience with enterprise-class relational databases or database management systems

If you are interested in pursuing a relationship with StarGarden, please submit your Cover Letter and Resume.
This is a remote-based opportunity, however, it is a client-facing role that may require occasional travel to client sites.

Title: Data Analytics Intermediate Analyst (Officer)
Description:
Data Analytics Intermediate Analyst (Officer)

 The Audit Innovation function is looking for a Data Analytics Intermediate Analyst to join the Product and Function Team. The Audit Innovation and Analytics function works with members of Internal Audit to identify automation opportunities and develop processes to support the development of audit analytics. The candidate must be proficient in the development and use of analytics technology and tools to provide automated solutions that enhance audit efficiency and effectiveness, and have functional knowledge of banking processes and related risks and controls.

 Key Responsibilities:

 Pro-actively develops automated routines to help focus audit testing.
 Assisting audit teams in performing moderately complex audits related to Consumer or Investment Banking, technology management; project/program management; or supplier management in accordance with corporate methodologies and professional standards.
 Providing coaching to team members regarding the use of automation in all phases of the audit process.
 Participating in the innovative use of audit analytics through direct participation in all phases of audits (i.e., business monitoring, planning, fieldwork, reporting).
 Assisting in defining data needs, designing and executing audit analytics during audits in accordance with the audit methodology and professional standards.
 Applies understanding of business processes, risks and controls to identify opportunities to enhance audit efficiencies and effectiveness through the development and delivery of automated processes.
 Strong verbal and written communication skills to clearly articulate analytics requirements and results, and make practical recommendations for analytics enhancements.
 Detail oriented, performing diligent self-reviews of work product, and attention to data completeness and accuracy
 Develop professional relationships with product and technology audit teams to assist in the definition of audit analytics opportunities for assigned audits and business monitoring activities.
 Develop effective working relationships with technology and business management of the area being audited.
 Promote the use of audit analytics and provide training to team members regarding the use of analytics to enhance all phases of the audit process.
 Promoting continuous improvement in all aspects of audit automation activities (e.g., technical environment, software, operating procedures).


 Key Qualifications and Competencies

 At least 2 years of business / audit analyst experience in providing automated solutions to business needs.
 Work experience in global environment and in large company.
 Excellent technical, programming and databases skills
 Excellent analytical ability to understand business processes and related risks and controls, and develop innovative audit analytics based upon audit needs.
 Strong interpersonal and multicultural skills for interfacing with all levels of internal and external audit and management.
 Self-driven, problem solving approach. Understanding of procedures and following these to keep quality and security of processes.


 Proficiency in one or more of the following technical skills:

 SAS
 SQL
 VBA
 Python
 MS Access
 JAVA


 Proficiency in at least one of the following Data Visualization tools is a plus:

 Power BI
 QlikView
 MicroStrategy


 Experience of the following areas would be a plus:

 Business Intelligence including use of statistics, data modelling, data mining and predictive analytics
 the Banking Businesses (i.e., Institutional Clients Group, Consumer, Corporate Functions) or areas of expertise (i.e. Anti-Money Laundering, Regulatory Reporting)
 Big Data analysis including big data dedicated use like HUE, Hive
 Project Management / Solution Development Life Cycle


 What we offer:

 A chance to develop in a highly innovative environment where you can use the newest technologies in a top quality organizational culture.
 Professional development in a truly global environment
 Inclusive and friendly corporate culture where gender diversity and equality is widely recognized
 A supportive workplace for professionals returning to the office from childcare leave
 An enjoyable and challenging learning path, which leads to a deep understanding of Citi’s products and services
 Yearly discretionary bonus and competitive social benefits (private medical care, multisport, life insurance, award-winning pension scheme, holiday allowance, flexible working schedule and other)


 This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

 Job Family Group: Technology

 Job Family: Data Analytics

 Time Type: Full time

Title: Business Planning & Performance Analyst
Description:
Job Description: 
 
 We are Canada Life



 Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.
 




  You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.
 

 


  Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.
 


 Be your best at Canada Life.
 


 We are looking for a 
  Business Planning & Performance Analyst


 Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: Regina, London, Winnipeg, or Toronto.


 Responsible for supporting, developing and maintaining PSS’ business plan and expense budget including: forecasts and reviews, ongoing business performance monitoring, reporting, analysis and insights, financial modelling of emerging business opportunities, capacity planning, key performance indicators (KPIs) as well as process improvements benefits realization. The role’s challenges lie primarily in the breadth of its accountabilities, requiring significant agility, a nose for inconsistencies, and the ability to go beyond the analysis of data to arrive at true business insight.
 




What you will do



 Service Delivery

 The main goal of the Plan Sponsor Services teams is to provide high-quality and responsive service within established best-in-industry service standards. The Business Planning and Performance analyst contributes to achieving this goal by:

 Designing and providing actionable reporting to leaders on various KPIs
 Designing and maintaining staff resources and forecasts appropriately
 Maintaining key performance metrics
 Supporting roll-out of digital strategy


 Performance Management


 Manage relationships with all areas of Plan Sponsor Services, Finance and Corporate Performance Management in a seamless manner
 Provide financial analysis and management reporting, including delivery of commentaries and executive summaries to support leaders’ decisions, provide impacts and quantifications of prospective or potential decisions
 Design and maintain financial models
 Support the development of business cases to provide cost/benefit analysis on opportunities impacting Plan Sponsor services teams
 Design, coordinating and distribute scorecards and dashboards on KPIs
 Design, capture and analyze Benefits Realization report on PSS Operational Excellence implemented initiatives to capture efficiencies
 Draw reliable and timely financial and non-financial data and information together from a wide range of sources and provide thorough analysis, insights and options to enable the Leadership team to make sound business decisions. Ensure single source of truth
 Design and deliver ad hoc performance reporting and analytics for a range of business requirements
 Support the financial modelling activity for strategic business opportunities and initiatives using a range of modelling and scenario-building tools, ensuring rigorous testing of assumptions and risks to aid high quality decision-making by the Leadership team


 Expense budget and capacity planning


 Maintain leading practice processes for business planning, expense budgeting, performance monitoring and analysis, financial modelling, and post-investment review
 Support the annual PSS business planning and budgeting cycle, including budget development as well as periodic reviews with cost centre owners, and reforecasting
 Coordinate annual expense budget and capacity planning for all areas in Plan Sponsor Services
 Continuously analyze expenses and capacity for variances
 Actively participate in PSS initiatives and projects as required


 What you will bring


 Understands the business environment and customer needs
 Open to new approaches, challenge the status quo and inspire creativity
 Innovative and visionary thinking; willingness to bring new concepts or approaches to our environment
 Driven to improve - the organization, processes, service performance, efficiency, etc
 Motivated to develop skills to meet strategic direction and tomorrow’s needs
 Fosters collaborative relationships across functions and the business and facilitates cooperation; is highly skilled in networking inside the company
 Demonstrated ability to build and manage relationships and work through influence
 Drives results and contributes to change processes that improve organizational performance and creates a culture of accountability
 Possesses a continuous improvement orientation
 Has a bias for actions
 Able to prioritize, focus and balance multiple priorities at all times. Can assess situations, make decisions, and get things done, with a high degree of agility and precision
 Understanding of employee benefits market and its dynamics
 Strong financial and business skills
 Excellent data and business analysis skills – ability to conduct detailed analysis, define KPIs, provide business logic and calculations, meet reporting requirements, etc
 Strong knowledge of business planning, budgeting and budget review processes, financial modelling, and performance analytics and reporting
 Highly developed analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to bring together diverse data and information and form sound judgments and insights
 In-depth knowledge of Microsoft 365, the Power tools and data analytics platforms
 Winning attitude; strong commitment to success; effective communicator amongst varied audiences and challenging circumstances
 Provides timely and full information so others can do their job effectively and feel connected to the organization’s broader goals


 Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today



 We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!



 Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.



 We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee 
has the opportunity to
 reach their potential.
