Title: Senior Data Analyst, MRM
Description:
MRM creatively engineers total human experiences. Through purposeful, dynamic intersections between strategy, creative, technology and data sciences, MRM operates in a borderless, integrated way, to allow for greater collaboration and velocity— all to the service of helping businesses grow meaningful relationships with people. MRM has 35-plus offices across North America, Latin America, Europe, the Middle East and Asia Pacific. For more information, please visit www.mrm.com.


 About the Role:
 The Sr. Data Analyst role will be responsible for executing a wide variety of database focused analyses in support of a client that is looking for help to join disparate data sets and develop more automated reporting solutions. This role will support the Manager in understanding the client’s business and analytic needs, in terms of developing reporting that promotes decision making and insights that drive to recommended actions. This role will work alongside a global team of resources to automate data ingestion, data cleansing and data management. In this role, the senior analyst will have exposure to a wide variety of data analysis and Business Intelligence tools such as Azure Synapse, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Power BI and will be expected to apply these tools on a daily basis.


 Responsibilities: 

Plan, design, and have ongoing accountability for the creation of cutting-edge visualizations to meet our client’s needs
Assist in building state-of-the-art, multi-cloud capable products by: 
   
Automating build and deployment processes
Creating solutions that include custom-made, open source and 3rd party solutions for solving pertinent business problems

Serve a multitude of functions including but not limited to: investigation of new product features, identifying new opportunities (in technology or to advance our client’s goals), creating internal processes for removing obstacles within the team
Responsible for creating documentation and educational materials that capture best practices for utilizing product, data governance and data management
Be an integral player in verification of enterprise databases to allow for confirmation of data integrity and investigation of any discrepancies
Utilize SQL (preferably MDX) to create new data engineering processes, perform database management, and identify best practices
Develop creative solutions in visualization, data management and automation that help drive our business forward
Continuously look for improvements, monitor quality levels, and manage quality problems
Lead client conversations related to ongoing initiatives where you embody our team’s “we’ll figure it out” mindset


 Required Skills
  Education and Experience

At least 3+ years of experience in data and analytics
Must demonstrate strong analytical skills
Highly accountable self-starter with the ability to work well within a group, as well as independently
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Information Technology preferred
Knowledge and experience with SQL (preferably in SQL Server) and MDX (preferred, not required) coding languages
Experience with ETL and ETL tools (SQL Server Integration Services is preferred, but other tools such as Airflow would work)
Demonstrated experience using Power BI (preferably with DAX experience) – with a keen eye towards industry trends in data visualization
Knowledge and experience within Azure preferred (Databricks or Data Factory to access Data Lakes, SSAS, Synapse and Function)
Certifications in Power BI and other tools listed above is desired
Some working business understanding, to help reclassify business data into usable format
Must have strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Must be able to handle multiple clients and projects simultaneously
Must be proficient in MS Office (Excel and PowerPoint); advanced Excel skills a plus
Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and evolve as business requirements change.



 MRM is an EEO/AA employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, marital status, citizenship, disability, genetic information or veteran status or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. MRM participates in e-Verify.


 If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, please submit your request through one of the following methods listed below:




a) Dedicated Fax - 917-661-6310


b) Dedicated E-mail – Careers@mwgdetroit.com


c) US Mail – ATTN: Human Resources, 360 W. Maple Birmingham, MI 48009


d) Dedicated Phone – 248-203-8000




 NOTE: Disability accommodation requests only.
 Required Experience

Title: Analyst, Investment Performance & Analytics
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you. 















Working Arrangement 













Hybrid 
 
Job Description 
Analyst, Investment Performance & Analytics - Montreal, Toronto 

Overview: 
The Investment Performance & Analytics (IP&A) team conducts thorough analysis and analytical review of investment performance, attribution, characteristics, and risk results across various investment strategies to support the front office, product specialists, risk, and reporting teams. 

The Analyst role is an entry-level position that is responsible for maintaining the quality and accuracy of investment portfolio data within multiple performance, attribution, and risk systems. The role requires knowledge of investment accounting principles, financial markets, financial instruments, and an intellectual curiosity in investment performance, attribution, risk, and analytics. The opportunity is for a proactive, motivated, and self-taught person who wants to work in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment. The candidate must be innovative, collaborative, and highly detailed oriented. 

Responsibilities: 

Supports the systems Start-of-Day (SOD) processes by performing control tolerance checks and data reconciliation to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used to calculate investment performance, attribution, characteristics, and risk results. 
Effectively identify and raise issues using proper escalation process for prompt resolution. 
Identify, research, and resolve investment performance data breaks. 
Perform and review data quality dashboards using Power BI. 
Review and refine existing controls/procedures to continuously improve the quality and ensure clear and concise documentation is created and maintained. 
Interact with appropriate individuals/groups to resolve errors as necessary. 
Participate and/or lead projects as assigned. 


Qualifications: 

Undergraduate degree in Finance or a business-related field. 
Enrolled or willing to pursue the CIPM and/or CFA designation. 
1-3 years of asset management industry experience. 
Analytical and quantitative reasoning skills. 
Experience working in an environment where controls and daily deadlines are required. 
Familiar with systems such as SS&C Sylvan, FactSet, Bloomberg, MSCI, and Morningstar Direct. 
Familiar with investment accounting principles, performance measurement methodologies, risk statistics, and attribution models. 
Experience with data analytics and data visualization (Microsoft Power BI). 
Comfortable in learning new technologies and working in a changing environment. 
Ability to work effectively with others in a team environment with diverse approaches and thinking styles. 
Strong organizational and interpersonal skills 
Communication in both English and/or French (verbal and written). 


French Job Description: 

Analyste, Mesure et analyse du rendement des placements, Montréal, Toronto 

Aperçu: 
L’équipe Mesure et analyse du rendement des placements effectue des analyses et des examens analytiques approfondis du rendement, de la répartition, des caractéristiques et des résultats en matière de risques des placements dans le cadre de diverses stratégies de placement afin de soutenir les équipes responsables des services de première ligne, risques et des rapports, ainsi que des équipes de spécialistes des produits. 

Le poste d’analyste est un de premier échelon. Le titulaire du poste sera responsable de maintenir la qualité et l’exactitude des données des portefeuilles de placements dans de multiples systèmes de rendement, de répartition et de gestion des risques. Le titulaire du poste doit connaître les principes de la comptabilité des investissements, les marchés financiers et les instruments financiers, et faire preuve d’une curiosité intellectuelle en matière de rendement, d’attribution, de risque et d’analyse des placements. La personne doit être proactive, motivée et autodidacte qui souhaite travailler dans un environnement dynamique en rapide évolution. Elle doit faire preuve d’innovation, de collaboration et d’un grand souci du détail. 

Responsabilités: 

Soutenir les processus de début de journée des systèmes en effectuant des contrôles de tolérance et des rapprochements de données pour assurer l’exactitude et l’exhaustivité des renseignements utilisés pour calculer le rendement des placements, l’attribution, les caractéristiques et les résultats en matière de risque. 
Repérer et signaler efficacement les problèmes au moyen d’un processus de transmission à un échelon supérieur approprié pour une résolution rapide. 
Repérer, rechercher et résoudre les problèmes liés aux données sur le rendement des placements. 
Effectuer et examiner les tableaux de bord de la qualité des données au moyen de Power BI. 
Examiner et peaufiner les procédures et les contrôles existants pour améliorer de manière continue la qualité et veiller à la création et à la tenue à jour de documents clairs et concis. 
Interagir avec les personnes ou les groupes appropriés pour résoudre les erreurs, au besoin. 
Participer ou diriger des projets selon les tâches assignées. 


Compétences: 

Baccalauréat en finance ou dans un domaine connexe lié aux affaires. 
Adhésion ou volonté d’obtenir le titre de CIPM ou de CFA. 
De un à trois ans d’expérience dans le secteur de la gestion d’actifs. 
Aptitudes pour le raisonnement analytique et quantitatif. 
Expérience de travail dans un environnement où des mesures de contrôle et des échéances quotidiennes sont requises. 
Connaissance des systèmes comme SS&C Sylvan, FactSet, Bloomberg, MSCI et Morningstar Direct. 
Connaissance des principes de la comptabilité des investissements, des méthodes de mesure du rendement, des statistiques sur les risques et des modèles d’attribution. 
Expérience en analyse et en visualisation de données (Microsoft Power BI). 
À l’aise d’apprendre à utiliser de nouvelles technologies et de travailler dans un environnement en constante évolution. 
Capacité à travailler efficacement avec les autres dans un environnement d’équipe avec des approches et des façons de penser. 
Excellentes aptitudes pour l’organisation et les relations interpersonnelles. 
Aptitudes pour la communication verbale et écrite, en français et en anglais. 


Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today. 

About John Hancock and Manulife 

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com . 

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com . 

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer 

At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

Title: IT- Business Analyst
Description:
Position Overview: Business Analyst, Data & Analytics
 About Northland Recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, and sports & entertainment. Northland Properties Corporation is the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, the Dallas Stars, Grouse Mountain, Revelstoke Mountain Resort, and Northland Asset Management Company. 
Business Challenge As Northland continues to rapidly expand its business across Canada, the US, and the UK, the company invests in cutting-edge technology to build a more customized and localized experience for its target markets. Technology and Marketing teams spearhead initiatives such as a new eCommerce platform, Data Lake, CRM & ERP, and other future-focused Hotel and Restaurant technologies. 
Opportunity Northland is looking for a Business Analyst who will be a part of our Project Delivery team, working specifically in the Data and Analytics arena. They will be responsible for project initiation and perform detailed requirement analysis, document processes, effectively communicate, gather information and present to all the stakeholders involved.
 They will be required to collaborate with multiple stakeholders across our business and technical teams to understand the business problem and identify and define the requirements, including data objects, data flow and business logic necessary for information architecture assessment.
 This position is based in Vancouver, Canada and will report to the Director, Project Delivery. They will work closely with the IT, Finance, Marketing, and other internal departments to complete requirement gathering and ensure successful hand-off.
 Responsibilities:

 Understand, determine and document detailed business and data analysis, including functional & non-functional requirements, by engaging with SMEs across the business lines.
 Document use cases, current & future business processes, workflows and diagrams as required and evaluate if the implementation team has the necessary details for project development.
 Apply strategic and analytical skills to communicate and capture business problems and requirements effectively.
 Document data dictionary, mapping information, business rules and ownership information for managing the data. 
Support, facilitate and enhance the data requirement processes
 Partner with stakeholders across Northland to shape a data-centric culture for handling Analytics projects
 Engage with the Data & Analytics team in maintaining data repository, executing data governance policies, and documenting and maintaining data requirement templates and other data-related artifacts.
 Prepare, present and communicate project updates with all the stakeholders regularly to ensure no gaps.
 Identify, monitor and communicate risk to the stakeholders throughout the project life-cycle.
 Support the team in testing project releases, communicating the operational plan and successful project handoff.
 Provide support by developing project plans, identifying scope, defining deliverables, planning milestones, status updates, establishing proper communication and mitigating any roadblocks.


 Skills & Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management of Technology, Information Systems, Business Administration or equivalent work experience
 At least four years of experience leading organizations through business analysis and requirements gathering across organizational silos, preferably with data-related projects.
 Experience working on Data & Analytics projects; Understanding of Data Management, Business Intelligence and Analytics concepts, including Data dictionary, Metadata management, Data governance, ETL, data lakes, visualization & reporting
 Exposure to both Agile & waterfall frameworks.
 Working Knowledge of Jira & Confluence.
 CCBA/CBAP certification is a bonus.
 Strong communication skills coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills.
 Experience eliciting and documenting requirement documents clearly and concisely.
 Creative thinker with excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
 Clear results orientation focuses on achieving both short-term and long-term goals. 
Expertise working with Excel, Visio/Lucid charts and other Microsoft suite products.
 Able to multi-task and prioritize workload
 Experience in the hospitality and travel industry preferred

 SUMMATION:
 Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.
 You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.
 **Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.
 **We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**
 **ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Title: Market Research Analyst (Full-Time) - Zonda Urban
Description:
Market Research Analyst  Full-Time (Toronto, ON)
 Zonda Home Canada is redefining the future of housing. We are the parent company of Zonda Urban and perfectly placed in the heart of the fast-growing real estate industry. We are making big bets on the future of real-estate, trailblazing a 2030 vision for the industry. Here at Zonda, you’ll be able to use your passion and curiosity to drive the next generation of real estate analysts, advisors, and technologists. Zonda is looking for a passionate Market Research Analyst to evolve and expand our team.

 Zonda looks for people who can grow, think, dream, and create. When you join our team, you’ll be in a unique position to make a change with every project. You’ll use your full range of skills to build great experiences and learn about the real estate industry, economics, and data. You’ll be supported with the necessary tools, and you'll be working with an awesome and like-minded team. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary, and collaborative - all working to build the future of housing.

 Who We Are
 Zonda Urban | Zonda Home Canada Inc. is a market-leading research and advisory firm specializing in the collection and analysis of new multi-family residential development data in British Columbia, Alberta, and Ontario. Zonda Urban strives to provide a dynamic and team-oriented work environment that offers team-members the opportunity to grow their knowledge and experience within the organization.

 We are looking for someone with positive energy, a strong work ethic and a willingness to learn and grow in the position of Market Research Analyst. Reporting to the Senior Market Analysts and the principals of Zonda Urban, the Market Research Analyst is responsible for assisting with a variety of tasks related to the collection and maintenance of new multi-family home project data in Zonda Urban's proprietary NHSLive data product, and to provide support for our advisory services


 What You’ll Do
 In this role, you will be responsible for:

Collect data on new condominium and townhome projects and newer rental apartment developments throughout the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area using primary and secondary research methods;
Assist with inputting data and relevant information collected from all monitored multi-family projects into Zonda Urban’s NHSLive data platform;
Identify and monitor the pre-launch marketing of all new multi-family projects;
Monitor new rental/multi-family development applications submitted to municipal planning departments throughout the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area, and input/update data on NHSLive;
Monitor economic indicators relevant to the new multi-family development industry as required; and,
Provide general support for data products and advisory


Who You Are

Working knowledge of Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area
Background in real estate, geography, housing, economics, urban studies are preferred
Strong interest in and desire to learn about the residential real estate market and development industry
Organized and resourceful with strong research skills/abilities and work ethic
Ease of use of spreadsheet and primary data analysis software
Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
Ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment
Have received or are working towards Post-Secondary degree or diploma in related fields of business
Candidate must have a valid driver’s license, access to a vehicle and be willing to travel. (Driving expenses incurred will be reimbursed)
Excellent interpersonal and social skills
At ease communicating with the public in person, phone, email, etc.
A positive and team-first attitude



 Why People Love Working Here

We offer meaningful work and opportunities for career growth
Competitive Salary
Comprehensive benefit package (Medical, Dental, Vision)
Paid vacation and general holidays
Education Allowance
Employee & Family Assistance Program (EFAP)



 Inclusion & Equal Opportunity Employment
 We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, inclusion & belonging. People seeking employment at Zonda Home Canada Inc. are considered without regard to any protected category including but not limited to, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

 Require an Accommodation? We’re here to help
 We are proud to provide interview & employment accommodation during the recruitment and hiring process. If you require any accommodation to apply or interview for a position, please reach out directly to jlata@zondahome.com. We are committed to work with you to best meet your needs.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   What You'll Be Doing
 

   You’ll be joining the Currency, Capacity & Refresh Team (CCR) as part of the Infrastructure, Planning and Engineering (IPE) group in Technology Operations. Our purpose is to mitigate technology risk by engaging with technology partners to remediate aging infrastructure (hardware & software). As a Business Systems Analyst you will be contributing to and supporting the management of the CCR reporting engine. This includes: ongoing reviews of data quality, weekly/monthly/quarterly/ad hoc reporting, end-to-end ownership of custom reporting for regional entities, participating in annual planning activities, participation in audit activities, and leading internal initiatives to enhance and expand our reporting capabilities.
 


   The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for formulating system scope and objectives, validating developed requirements, testing, training and implementing applications, and providing end user support. The role performs tasks of technical depth and breadth, validating and documenting business requirements for assigned projects to ensure the maximization of operational efficiency, and ensuring project control procedures and policies are executed. Business Systems Analyst determines methods and approaches to projects, providing business support relative to the development, analysis and identification of process changes or system enhancements. The role uses judgement and autonomy on day to day tasks, providing operational support for projects after implementation including problem resolution and recommendations to ensure ongoing success. The role proactively addresses problems within the scope of responsibility and identifies areas for possible improvements.
 


 At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.



   How You'll Succeed
 


   Reporting - Provide business as usual reporting functions which will consist of designing, augmenting, and maintaining reports for a variety of CCR audiences.
 

   Analytical mindset - Use strong problem solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills to overcome anomalies encountered during data collection, data quality review and report generation.
 

   Communication skills - Communicate well, both written and verbally, with different functional groups and all levels of stakeholders within Technology.
 


   Who You Are
 

   You can demonstrate experience in working with Microsoft Office Suite including advanced skills using Excel pivots, tables and charts. Understanding macros is a plus. Minimum of 2 years of experience as Business Systems Analyst
 

   Knowledge and understanding of various infrastructure platforms and services (e.g. servers, database, middleware, BI)
   You're a positive go-getter. You're positive, curious, love to learn, self-motivated and take initiative.
 

   You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.
 

   You're confident in your ability to communicate both written and orally, detailed information in an impactful way.
 


   What CIBC Offers
 

   At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
 



     We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
   


     Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
   


     We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.
   



   What you need to know
 



     CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
    
     Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
    



     You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
   



   Job Location
  Toronto-81 Bay, 19th Floor
 
   Employment Type
  Regular
 

   Weekly Hours
  37.5
 
   Skills
 
 Analytical Thinking, Communication, Critical Thinking, Customized Reporting, Data Collections, Microsoft Office, Planning Activities, Problem Solving, Process Changes, Taking Initiative

Title: Enterprise Security Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 154863
 Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

 The Cyber Security team is responsible for developing, implementing and sustaining Tangerine’s Cyber Security Programs and ensuring Tangerine remains compliant with regulatory expectations and Scotiabank’s policies and standards. The Enterprise Security Analyst is responsible for many aspects of Tangerine’s Cyber Security programs. The incumbent will be responsible for leading programs such as vulnerability/patch management, security scanning, data loss prevention, and security reporting programs. The Analyst will utilize a risk-based approach in order to produce substantiated, relevant data to be utilized within a regularly produced security dashboard.
 Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:


 Act as core competency and subject matter expert reference for business lines in the matters of governance, risk management, advisory, and compliance.
 Coordinate security scans on the Bank’s servers and endpoints
 Manage, track and report on identified vulnerabilities and collaborate with stakeholders to remediate and resolve vulnerabilities in a timely manner
 Monitor and respond to data loss alerts
 Review and analyze data loss alerts for effectiveness (rule logic tuning)
 Prepare monthly and quarterly statistical reports summarizing security activities, and tasks performed.
 Administrate and maintain security technology tools and platforms


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? - We'd love to work with you if you have:


 Knowledge and experience in monitoring and tracking cyber threats and vulnerabilities
 Knowledge and skill in performing cyber threat and vulnerability impact/risk assessments
 Ability to identify systemic security issues based on analysis of vulnerability and configuration data.
 Knowledge and experience in identifying data loss risk vectors and deploying detection and prevention counter measures.
 Knowledge of computer networking concepts, network protocols and network security methodologies.
 Knowledge of system administration, network and operating system hardening techniques
 Knowledge and experience in security scanning technologies and methodologies (vulnerability scanners, SAST, DAST, SCA, etc.)


 What's in it for you?


 We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
 We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences
 You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
 Dress codes don't apply here, being comfortable does
 Access to thousands of online and in-person courses so you can brush up on skills or learn new ones
 Career progression opportunities. We hire you for your talent and not just for the job. We want to see you succeed not just in your role but in your career as a whole
 We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), vacation, personal & sick days, paternity/maternity leave, medical, vision and dental benefits and much more

 #LI-Hybrid
 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : North York
 At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

Title: ST-Analyst, Enterprise Data Office
Description:
About Apotex Inc.
Apotex Inc. is a proudly Canadian, global pharmaceutical company that produces high-quality, affordable medicines for patients around the world. Apotex employs almost 8,000 people worldwide in manufacturing, R&D, and commercial operations. Apotex Inc. exports to more than 100 countries and territories and operates in more than 45 countries, with a significant presence in Canada, the US, Mexico, and India. Through vertical integration, Apotex is comprised of multiple divisions and affiliates including Apotex Inc., focused on generics; Apobiologix, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on biosimilar development; Aveva, an affiliate of Apotex Inc. fully integrated global developer and manufacturer of complete transdermal solutions; Apotex Consumer Products, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on brand name products; and Global Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (GAPI), a division of Apotex Inc. focused on the manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for Apotex and third parties. For more information visit: www.apotex.com.



 Job Summary


 The role will focus on master data audits and cleanup. The successful candidate should have strong principles of SQL language and be able to read, understand and write SQL scripts. Data structures knowledge will be required for this position. The position will be hands on with data 80% of the time. There is a documentation component which will be expected and guided throughtout the work term length.




 Job Responsibilities



Master data audit and cleanup
Documentation of findings after audits are completed
Development of solutions related to master data inaccuracies.

Additional Responsibilities:

Works in a safe manner collaborating as a team member to achieve all outcomes.
Demonstrate Behaviours that exhibit our organizational Values: Collaboration, Courage, Perseverance, and Passion.
Ensure personal adherence with all compliance programs including the Global Business Ethics and Compliance Program, Global Quality policies and procedures, Safety and Environment policies, and HR policies.
All other relevant duties as assigned.








Job Requirements



Education

Must be enrolled in a recognized post-secondary Co-op education program (Database Application Developer)

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Must be able to work on 6-12 month work term projects and read SQL code.
Prior academic or work coding experience
Autodidactism is a must. Candidate will need to learn on his/her own Transact-SQL scripting and any other computer language as required within a reasonable timeframe.

Experience

Academic experience with projects where SQL was used
Extra curricular experience with SQL or coding will be an asset
 





At Apotex, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported.
Apotex offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, MRM
Description:
MRM creatively engineers total human experiences. Through purposeful, dynamic intersections between strategy, creative, technology and data sciences, MRM operates in a borderless, integrated way, to allow for greater collaboration and velocity— all to the service of helping businesses grow meaningful relationships with people. MRM has 35-plus offices across North America, Latin America, Europe, the Middle East and Asia Pacific. For more information, please visit www.mrm.com.


 About the Role:
 The Sr. Data Analyst role will be responsible for executing a wide variety of database focused analyses in support of a client that is looking for help to join disparate data sets and develop more automated reporting solutions. This role will support the Manager in understanding the client’s business and analytic needs, in terms of developing reporting that promotes decision making and insights that drive to recommended actions. This role will work alongside a global team of resources to automate data ingestion, data cleansing and data management. In this role, the senior analyst will have exposure to a wide variety of data analysis and Business Intelligence tools such as Azure Synapse, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Power BI and will be expected to apply these tools on a daily basis.


 Responsibilities: 

Plan, design, and have ongoing accountability for the creation of cutting-edge visualizations to meet our client’s needs
Assist in building state-of-the-art, multi-cloud capable products by: 
   
Automating build and deployment processes
Creating solutions that include custom-made, open source and 3rd party solutions for solving pertinent business problems

Serve a multitude of functions including but not limited to: investigation of new product features, identifying new opportunities (in technology or to advance our client’s goals), creating internal processes for removing obstacles within the team
Responsible for creating documentation and educational materials that capture best practices for utilizing product, data governance and data management
Be an integral player in verification of enterprise databases to allow for confirmation of data integrity and investigation of any discrepancies
Utilize SQL (preferably MDX) to create new data engineering processes, perform database management, and identify best practices
Develop creative solutions in visualization, data management and automation that help drive our business forward
Continuously look for improvements, monitor quality levels, and manage quality problems
Lead client conversations related to ongoing initiatives where you embody our team’s “we’ll figure it out” mindset


 Required Skills
  Education and Experience

At least 3+ years of experience in data and analytics
Must demonstrate strong analytical skills
Highly accountable self-starter with the ability to work well within a group, as well as independently
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Information Technology preferred
Knowledge and experience with SQL (preferably in SQL Server) and MDX (preferred, not required) coding languages
Experience with ETL and ETL tools (SQL Server Integration Services is preferred, but other tools such as Airflow would work)
Demonstrated experience using Power BI (preferably with DAX experience) – with a keen eye towards industry trends in data visualization
Knowledge and experience within Azure preferred (Databricks or Data Factory to access Data Lakes, SSAS, Synapse and Function)
Certifications in Power BI and other tools listed above is desired
Some working business understanding, to help reclassify business data into usable format
Must have strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Must be able to handle multiple clients and projects simultaneously
Must be proficient in MS Office (Excel and PowerPoint); advanced Excel skills a plus
Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and evolve as business requirements change.



 MRM is an EEO/AA employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, marital status, citizenship, disability, genetic information or veteran status or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. MRM participates in e-Verify.


 If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, please submit your request through one of the following methods listed below:




a) Dedicated Fax - 917-661-6310


b) Dedicated E-mail – Careers@mwgdetroit.com


c) US Mail – ATTN: Human Resources, 360 W. Maple Birmingham, MI 48009


d) Dedicated Phone – 248-203-8000




 NOTE: Disability accommodation requests only.
 Required Experience

Title: Analyst, Investment Performance & Analytics
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you. 















Working Arrangement 













Hybrid 
 
Job Description 
Analyst, Investment Performance & Analytics - Montreal, Toronto 

Overview: 
The Investment Performance & Analytics (IP&A) team conducts thorough analysis and analytical review of investment performance, attribution, characteristics, and risk results across various investment strategies to support the front office, product specialists, risk, and reporting teams. 

The Analyst role is an entry-level position that is responsible for maintaining the quality and accuracy of investment portfolio data within multiple performance, attribution, and risk systems. The role requires knowledge of investment accounting principles, financial markets, financial instruments, and an intellectual curiosity in investment performance, attribution, risk, and analytics. The opportunity is for a proactive, motivated, and self-taught person who wants to work in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment. The candidate must be innovative, collaborative, and highly detailed oriented. 

Responsibilities: 

Supports the systems Start-of-Day (SOD) processes by performing control tolerance checks and data reconciliation to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used to calculate investment performance, attribution, characteristics, and risk results. 
Effectively identify and raise issues using proper escalation process for prompt resolution. 
Identify, research, and resolve investment performance data breaks. 
Perform and review data quality dashboards using Power BI. 
Review and refine existing controls/procedures to continuously improve the quality and ensure clear and concise documentation is created and maintained. 
Interact with appropriate individuals/groups to resolve errors as necessary. 
Participate and/or lead projects as assigned. 


Qualifications: 

Undergraduate degree in Finance or a business-related field. 
Enrolled or willing to pursue the CIPM and/or CFA designation. 
1-3 years of asset management industry experience. 
Analytical and quantitative reasoning skills. 
Experience working in an environment where controls and daily deadlines are required. 
Familiar with systems such as SS&C Sylvan, FactSet, Bloomberg, MSCI, and Morningstar Direct. 
Familiar with investment accounting principles, performance measurement methodologies, risk statistics, and attribution models. 
Experience with data analytics and data visualization (Microsoft Power BI). 
Comfortable in learning new technologies and working in a changing environment. 
Ability to work effectively with others in a team environment with diverse approaches and thinking styles. 
Strong organizational and interpersonal skills 
Communication in both English and/or French (verbal and written). 


French Job Description: 

Analyste, Mesure et analyse du rendement des placements, Montréal, Toronto 

Aperçu: 
L’équipe Mesure et analyse du rendement des placements effectue des analyses et des examens analytiques approfondis du rendement, de la répartition, des caractéristiques et des résultats en matière de risques des placements dans le cadre de diverses stratégies de placement afin de soutenir les équipes responsables des services de première ligne, risques et des rapports, ainsi que des équipes de spécialistes des produits. 

Le poste d’analyste est un de premier échelon. Le titulaire du poste sera responsable de maintenir la qualité et l’exactitude des données des portefeuilles de placements dans de multiples systèmes de rendement, de répartition et de gestion des risques. Le titulaire du poste doit connaître les principes de la comptabilité des investissements, les marchés financiers et les instruments financiers, et faire preuve d’une curiosité intellectuelle en matière de rendement, d’attribution, de risque et d’analyse des placements. La personne doit être proactive, motivée et autodidacte qui souhaite travailler dans un environnement dynamique en rapide évolution. Elle doit faire preuve d’innovation, de collaboration et d’un grand souci du détail. 

Responsabilités: 

Soutenir les processus de début de journée des systèmes en effectuant des contrôles de tolérance et des rapprochements de données pour assurer l’exactitude et l’exhaustivité des renseignements utilisés pour calculer le rendement des placements, l’attribution, les caractéristiques et les résultats en matière de risque. 
Repérer et signaler efficacement les problèmes au moyen d’un processus de transmission à un échelon supérieur approprié pour une résolution rapide. 
Repérer, rechercher et résoudre les problèmes liés aux données sur le rendement des placements. 
Effectuer et examiner les tableaux de bord de la qualité des données au moyen de Power BI. 
Examiner et peaufiner les procédures et les contrôles existants pour améliorer de manière continue la qualité et veiller à la création et à la tenue à jour de documents clairs et concis. 
Interagir avec les personnes ou les groupes appropriés pour résoudre les erreurs, au besoin. 
Participer ou diriger des projets selon les tâches assignées. 


Compétences: 

Baccalauréat en finance ou dans un domaine connexe lié aux affaires. 
Adhésion ou volonté d’obtenir le titre de CIPM ou de CFA. 
De un à trois ans d’expérience dans le secteur de la gestion d’actifs. 
Aptitudes pour le raisonnement analytique et quantitatif. 
Expérience de travail dans un environnement où des mesures de contrôle et des échéances quotidiennes sont requises. 
Connaissance des systèmes comme SS&C Sylvan, FactSet, Bloomberg, MSCI et Morningstar Direct. 
Connaissance des principes de la comptabilité des investissements, des méthodes de mesure du rendement, des statistiques sur les risques et des modèles d’attribution. 
Expérience en analyse et en visualisation de données (Microsoft Power BI). 
À l’aise d’apprendre à utiliser de nouvelles technologies et de travailler dans un environnement en constante évolution. 
Capacité à travailler efficacement avec les autres dans un environnement d’équipe avec des approches et des façons de penser. 
Excellentes aptitudes pour l’organisation et les relations interpersonnelles. 
Aptitudes pour la communication verbale et écrite, en français et en anglais. 


Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today. 

About John Hancock and Manulife 

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com . 

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com . 

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer 

At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

Title: IT- Business Analyst
Description:
Position Overview: Business Analyst, Data & Analytics
 About Northland Recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, and sports & entertainment. Northland Properties Corporation is the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, the Dallas Stars, Grouse Mountain, Revelstoke Mountain Resort, and Northland Asset Management Company. 
Business Challenge As Northland continues to rapidly expand its business across Canada, the US, and the UK, the company invests in cutting-edge technology to build a more customized and localized experience for its target markets. Technology and Marketing teams spearhead initiatives such as a new eCommerce platform, Data Lake, CRM & ERP, and other future-focused Hotel and Restaurant technologies. 
Opportunity Northland is looking for a Business Analyst who will be a part of our Project Delivery team, working specifically in the Data and Analytics arena. They will be responsible for project initiation and perform detailed requirement analysis, document processes, effectively communicate, gather information and present to all the stakeholders involved.
 They will be required to collaborate with multiple stakeholders across our business and technical teams to understand the business problem and identify and define the requirements, including data objects, data flow and business logic necessary for information architecture assessment.
 This position is based in Vancouver, Canada and will report to the Director, Project Delivery. They will work closely with the IT, Finance, Marketing, and other internal departments to complete requirement gathering and ensure successful hand-off.
 Responsibilities:

 Understand, determine and document detailed business and data analysis, including functional & non-functional requirements, by engaging with SMEs across the business lines.
 Document use cases, current & future business processes, workflows and diagrams as required and evaluate if the implementation team has the necessary details for project development.
 Apply strategic and analytical skills to communicate and capture business problems and requirements effectively.
 Document data dictionary, mapping information, business rules and ownership information for managing the data. 
Support, facilitate and enhance the data requirement processes
 Partner with stakeholders across Northland to shape a data-centric culture for handling Analytics projects
 Engage with the Data & Analytics team in maintaining data repository, executing data governance policies, and documenting and maintaining data requirement templates and other data-related artifacts.
 Prepare, present and communicate project updates with all the stakeholders regularly to ensure no gaps.
 Identify, monitor and communicate risk to the stakeholders throughout the project life-cycle.
 Support the team in testing project releases, communicating the operational plan and successful project handoff.
 Provide support by developing project plans, identifying scope, defining deliverables, planning milestones, status updates, establishing proper communication and mitigating any roadblocks.


 Skills & Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management of Technology, Information Systems, Business Administration or equivalent work experience
 At least four years of experience leading organizations through business analysis and requirements gathering across organizational silos, preferably with data-related projects.
 Experience working on Data & Analytics projects; Understanding of Data Management, Business Intelligence and Analytics concepts, including Data dictionary, Metadata management, Data governance, ETL, data lakes, visualization & reporting
 Exposure to both Agile & waterfall frameworks.
 Working Knowledge of Jira & Confluence.
 CCBA/CBAP certification is a bonus.
 Strong communication skills coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills.
 Experience eliciting and documenting requirement documents clearly and concisely.
 Creative thinker with excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
 Clear results orientation focuses on achieving both short-term and long-term goals. 
Expertise working with Excel, Visio/Lucid charts and other Microsoft suite products.
 Able to multi-task and prioritize workload
 Experience in the hospitality and travel industry preferred

 SUMMATION:
 Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.
 You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.
 **Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.
 **We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**
 **ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Title: Market Research Analyst (Full-Time) - Zonda Urban
Description:
Market Research Analyst  Full-Time (Toronto, ON)
 Zonda Home Canada is redefining the future of housing. We are the parent company of Zonda Urban and perfectly placed in the heart of the fast-growing real estate industry. We are making big bets on the future of real-estate, trailblazing a 2030 vision for the industry. Here at Zonda, you’ll be able to use your passion and curiosity to drive the next generation of real estate analysts, advisors, and technologists. Zonda is looking for a passionate Market Research Analyst to evolve and expand our team.

 Zonda looks for people who can grow, think, dream, and create. When you join our team, you’ll be in a unique position to make a change with every project. You’ll use your full range of skills to build great experiences and learn about the real estate industry, economics, and data. You’ll be supported with the necessary tools, and you'll be working with an awesome and like-minded team. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary, and collaborative - all working to build the future of housing.

 Who We Are
 Zonda Urban | Zonda Home Canada Inc. is a market-leading research and advisory firm specializing in the collection and analysis of new multi-family residential development data in British Columbia, Alberta, and Ontario. Zonda Urban strives to provide a dynamic and team-oriented work environment that offers team-members the opportunity to grow their knowledge and experience within the organization.

 We are looking for someone with positive energy, a strong work ethic and a willingness to learn and grow in the position of Market Research Analyst. Reporting to the Senior Market Analysts and the principals of Zonda Urban, the Market Research Analyst is responsible for assisting with a variety of tasks related to the collection and maintenance of new multi-family home project data in Zonda Urban's proprietary NHSLive data product, and to provide support for our advisory services


 What You’ll Do
 In this role, you will be responsible for:

Collect data on new condominium and townhome projects and newer rental apartment developments throughout the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area using primary and secondary research methods;
Assist with inputting data and relevant information collected from all monitored multi-family projects into Zonda Urban’s NHSLive data platform;
Identify and monitor the pre-launch marketing of all new multi-family projects;
Monitor new rental/multi-family development applications submitted to municipal planning departments throughout the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area, and input/update data on NHSLive;
Monitor economic indicators relevant to the new multi-family development industry as required; and,
Provide general support for data products and advisory


Who You Are

Working knowledge of Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area
Background in real estate, geography, housing, economics, urban studies are preferred
Strong interest in and desire to learn about the residential real estate market and development industry
Organized and resourceful with strong research skills/abilities and work ethic
Ease of use of spreadsheet and primary data analysis software
Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
Ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment
Have received or are working towards Post-Secondary degree or diploma in related fields of business
Candidate must have a valid driver’s license, access to a vehicle and be willing to travel. (Driving expenses incurred will be reimbursed)
Excellent interpersonal and social skills
At ease communicating with the public in person, phone, email, etc.
A positive and team-first attitude



 Why People Love Working Here

We offer meaningful work and opportunities for career growth
Competitive Salary
Comprehensive benefit package (Medical, Dental, Vision)
Paid vacation and general holidays
Education Allowance
Employee & Family Assistance Program (EFAP)



 Inclusion & Equal Opportunity Employment
 We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, inclusion & belonging. People seeking employment at Zonda Home Canada Inc. are considered without regard to any protected category including but not limited to, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

 Require an Accommodation? We’re here to help
 We are proud to provide interview & employment accommodation during the recruitment and hiring process. If you require any accommodation to apply or interview for a position, please reach out directly to jlata@zondahome.com. We are committed to work with you to best meet your needs.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   What You'll Be Doing
 

   You’ll be joining the Currency, Capacity & Refresh Team (CCR) as part of the Infrastructure, Planning and Engineering (IPE) group in Technology Operations. Our purpose is to mitigate technology risk by engaging with technology partners to remediate aging infrastructure (hardware & software). As a Business Systems Analyst you will be contributing to and supporting the management of the CCR reporting engine. This includes: ongoing reviews of data quality, weekly/monthly/quarterly/ad hoc reporting, end-to-end ownership of custom reporting for regional entities, participating in annual planning activities, participation in audit activities, and leading internal initiatives to enhance and expand our reporting capabilities.
 


   The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for formulating system scope and objectives, validating developed requirements, testing, training and implementing applications, and providing end user support. The role performs tasks of technical depth and breadth, validating and documenting business requirements for assigned projects to ensure the maximization of operational efficiency, and ensuring project control procedures and policies are executed. Business Systems Analyst determines methods and approaches to projects, providing business support relative to the development, analysis and identification of process changes or system enhancements. The role uses judgement and autonomy on day to day tasks, providing operational support for projects after implementation including problem resolution and recommendations to ensure ongoing success. The role proactively addresses problems within the scope of responsibility and identifies areas for possible improvements.
 


 At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.



   How You'll Succeed
 


   Reporting - Provide business as usual reporting functions which will consist of designing, augmenting, and maintaining reports for a variety of CCR audiences.
 

   Analytical mindset - Use strong problem solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills to overcome anomalies encountered during data collection, data quality review and report generation.
 

   Communication skills - Communicate well, both written and verbally, with different functional groups and all levels of stakeholders within Technology.
 


   Who You Are
 

   You can demonstrate experience in working with Microsoft Office Suite including advanced skills using Excel pivots, tables and charts. Understanding macros is a plus. Minimum of 2 years of experience as Business Systems Analyst
 

   Knowledge and understanding of various infrastructure platforms and services (e.g. servers, database, middleware, BI)
   You're a positive go-getter. You're positive, curious, love to learn, self-motivated and take initiative.
 

   You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.
 

   You're confident in your ability to communicate both written and orally, detailed information in an impactful way.
 


   What CIBC Offers
 

   At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
 



     We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
   


     Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
   


     We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.
   



   What you need to know
 



     CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
    
     Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
    



     You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
   



   Job Location
  Toronto-81 Bay, 19th Floor
 
   Employment Type
  Regular
 

   Weekly Hours
  37.5
 
   Skills
 
 Analytical Thinking, Communication, Critical Thinking, Customized Reporting, Data Collections, Microsoft Office, Planning Activities, Problem Solving, Process Changes, Taking Initiative
