Title: Enterprise Security Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 154863
 Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

 The Cyber Security team is responsible for developing, implementing and sustaining Tangerine’s Cyber Security Programs and ensuring Tangerine remains compliant with regulatory expectations and Scotiabank’s policies and standards. The Enterprise Security Analyst is responsible for many aspects of Tangerine’s Cyber Security programs. The incumbent will be responsible for leading programs such as vulnerability/patch management, security scanning, data loss prevention, and security reporting programs. The Analyst will utilize a risk-based approach in order to produce substantiated, relevant data to be utilized within a regularly produced security dashboard.
 Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:


 Act as core competency and subject matter expert reference for business lines in the matters of governance, risk management, advisory, and compliance.
 Coordinate security scans on the Bank’s servers and endpoints
 Manage, track and report on identified vulnerabilities and collaborate with stakeholders to remediate and resolve vulnerabilities in a timely manner
 Monitor and respond to data loss alerts
 Review and analyze data loss alerts for effectiveness (rule logic tuning)
 Prepare monthly and quarterly statistical reports summarizing security activities, and tasks performed.
 Administrate and maintain security technology tools and platforms


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? - We'd love to work with you if you have:


 Knowledge and experience in monitoring and tracking cyber threats and vulnerabilities
 Knowledge and skill in performing cyber threat and vulnerability impact/risk assessments
 Ability to identify systemic security issues based on analysis of vulnerability and configuration data.
 Knowledge and experience in identifying data loss risk vectors and deploying detection and prevention counter measures.
 Knowledge of computer networking concepts, network protocols and network security methodologies.
 Knowledge of system administration, network and operating system hardening techniques
 Knowledge and experience in security scanning technologies and methodologies (vulnerability scanners, SAST, DAST, SCA, etc.)


 What's in it for you?


 We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
 We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences
 You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
 Dress codes don't apply here, being comfortable does
 Access to thousands of online and in-person courses so you can brush up on skills or learn new ones
 Career progression opportunities. We hire you for your talent and not just for the job. We want to see you succeed not just in your role but in your career as a whole
 We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), vacation, personal & sick days, paternity/maternity leave, medical, vision and dental benefits and much more

 #LI-Hybrid
 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : North York
 At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

Title: ST-Analyst, Enterprise Data Office
Description:
About Apotex Inc.
Apotex Inc. is a proudly Canadian, global pharmaceutical company that produces high-quality, affordable medicines for patients around the world. Apotex employs almost 8,000 people worldwide in manufacturing, R&D, and commercial operations. Apotex Inc. exports to more than 100 countries and territories and operates in more than 45 countries, with a significant presence in Canada, the US, Mexico, and India. Through vertical integration, Apotex is comprised of multiple divisions and affiliates including Apotex Inc., focused on generics; Apobiologix, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on biosimilar development; Aveva, an affiliate of Apotex Inc. fully integrated global developer and manufacturer of complete transdermal solutions; Apotex Consumer Products, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on brand name products; and Global Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (GAPI), a division of Apotex Inc. focused on the manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for Apotex and third parties. For more information visit: www.apotex.com.



 Job Summary


 The role will focus on master data audits and cleanup. The successful candidate should have strong principles of SQL language and be able to read, understand and write SQL scripts. Data structures knowledge will be required for this position. The position will be hands on with data 80% of the time. There is a documentation component which will be expected and guided throughtout the work term length.




 Job Responsibilities



Master data audit and cleanup
Documentation of findings after audits are completed
Development of solutions related to master data inaccuracies.

Additional Responsibilities:

Works in a safe manner collaborating as a team member to achieve all outcomes.
Demonstrate Behaviours that exhibit our organizational Values: Collaboration, Courage, Perseverance, and Passion.
Ensure personal adherence with all compliance programs including the Global Business Ethics and Compliance Program, Global Quality policies and procedures, Safety and Environment policies, and HR policies.
All other relevant duties as assigned.








Job Requirements



Education

Must be enrolled in a recognized post-secondary Co-op education program (Database Application Developer)

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Must be able to work on 6-12 month work term projects and read SQL code.
Prior academic or work coding experience
Autodidactism is a must. Candidate will need to learn on his/her own Transact-SQL scripting and any other computer language as required within a reasonable timeframe.

Experience

Academic experience with projects where SQL was used
Extra curricular experience with SQL or coding will be an asset
 





At Apotex, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported.
Apotex offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

Title: Senior Business and Systems Analyst
Description:
JOB INFORMATION

Requisition ID: 5925
   
Number of Vacancies: 2
   
Department: Information Technology Services (20000014) - Enterprise Architecture (30000027)
   
Salary Information: $99,717.80 - $124,724.60
   
Pay Scale Group: 10SA
   
Employment Type: Regular
   
Weekly Hours: 35, 
   Off Days: Saturday and Sunday 
   Shift:

Posted On: July 13, 2022
   
Last Day to Apply: July 27, 2022
   
Reports to: Manager Business Architecture
  



   The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) is North America's third largest transit system and has been recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA. Guided by a forward-thinking strategic plan, the TTC's vision is to be a transit system that makes Toronto proud. The TTC's recruitment efforts are directly aligned to its mission of providing "a reliable, efficient, and integrated bus, streetcar and subway system that draws its high standards of customer care from our rich traditions of safety, service and courtesy."
  



General Accountability



       The Senior Business & System Analyst is responsible for reviewing, analyzing and evaluating business solutions and user needs while serving as the key link between development resources and business users. The incumbent plans and conducts feasibility studies, creates solution proposals, gathers, documents and validates business requirements, identifies system requirements and creates solutions designs, directs system implementation and installation, and develops methods and procedures for systems of major complexity. The incumbent identifies and documents the functional and/or technical problems and devises solutions. The incumbent is also responsible for business process transformation and improvement including current process mapping, gap identification and future stat recommendations. May act as project leader or sub-section leader on large projects. On a continual basis, the incumbent expands the application use by clients, demonstrating business solutions, configuring the application, testing it, and training the clients in using the additional features.
     




 Key Job Functions



       Directing Systems Analysts and Programmer Analysts in the performance of their duties. This involves:
     

Assigning work to staff in accordance with their areas of expertise
Ensuring the quality of the analysis and programming meets established standards and practices
Responding to problems encountered by staff
Providing training and exposure to varied assignments to maintain level of expertise





      Developing and Implementing new computer systems and enhancing old systems. This involves:
     

Translating business problems and requirements into an information system solution following accepted methodology
Leading requirements gathering sessions with business users to create the functional specifications
Designing and developing proposals, forms, workflow, business, process and data modelling, business requirements and system specifications
Formulating and defining business problem and solution scope and objectives based on both user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems and requirements
Consulting extensively with clients and acting as key IT-business liaison during systems development life cycle
Determining the feasibility of applying system methods to solve business problem
Investigating existing systems and making recommendations concerning changes and enhancements
Developing systems, objectives, control procedures and processing cycle for assignment
Leading business process transformation and improvement processes, documenting current process mapping, identifying gaps, providing recommendations and developing future state process model and documentation.
Defining problem areas through discussions with client and Information Technology Services management
Developing formal documents including business requirements, functional design documents, non-functional design documents, system/solution specifications including workflow diagrams. User stories, user guide and training manual etc.
Interviewing appropriate personnel during requirements, analysis and design phases of problem solution
Developing strategies of approach and solution by utilizing accepted methods, standards and related tools and techniques
Providing recommendations on the selection and use of appropriate technology, including computer hardware and software
Contacting vendors and evaluating software and architecture for eventual implementation





Key Job Functions continued



       The Senior Business/System Analyst assists the Project Manager. This involves:
     

Assisting in preparing the section’s short-term business plan and budget
Assisting in the development of time, cost estimates and project timelines
Identifying and mitigating project risks
Acting as project leader on large complex systems
Reviewing detail work of Systems Analysts and Programmer Analysts
Advising and training more junior personnel on systems development methods, procedures, standards, tools and techniques
Consulting with clients to provide post-implementation needs
Participating data collection, input, application testing, issuing documentation, production start-up and client training
Liaising with groups affecting changes, including the server group, network services, Quality Assurance and others to obtain the required system architecture
Attending meetings as assigned.
Responsible for treating passengers and/or employees with respect and dignity and ensuring the needs of passengers or employees with disabilities are accommodated and/or addressed (if applicable and within their area of responsibility) in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Related Orders so that they can fully benefit from the TTC as a service-provider and an employer.
Performs related duties as assigned.





Skills



      Demonstrate specialized expertise and knowledge in the assigned field
     

       Manage projects
     

       Apply the principles and practices of quality assurance
     

       Apply analytical skills
     

       Gather information and conduct research
     

       Plan and organize activities / projects to meet section and organizational goals
     

       Communicate in a variety of mediums
     

       Interview and assess job candidates
     




 Education and Experience



University degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or the equivalent combined with directly related experience in systems development projects, tools and techniques.
Requires experience and extensive knowledge of business and systems development from methodology through analysis, detailed design development, implementation and production support, business process re-engineering, systems development tools and techniques such as process/data modelling
Must have a thorough understanding of project management, data security audit concepts, quality assurance principles and practices as well as structured techniques for business and systems analysis, design and development
Requires the ability to plan and conduct studies and reviews; prepare project viability assessment reports, business proposal reports and cost/benefit analysis of projects;





Additional Requirements



Completion of industry-recognized business analysis and/or project management certifications (e.g. IIBA-CBAP, PMI-PBA or PMI-PMP) would be an asset.
Work as part of a team in the development and implementation of large and complex systems and prepare system specifications and documentation
Must possess sound business judgment; highly developed analytical and problem solving skills; excellent organizational, interviewing, verbal and written communication skills
Ability to occasionally supervise, lead and motivate small project teams comprised of Systems Analysts and Programmer Analysts
Requires progressively responsible work experience in systems analysis and design, project administration and programming
Demonstrated ability to function as an integral member of project team as well as individually
Knowledgeable of current hardware and software computer environment and project management and systems development life cycle methodology
Must have or rapidly acquire a comprehensive knowledge of the Ontario Human Rights Code and Related Orders including disability accommodation and accessibility requirements pertaining to passengers and employees





   The TTC is committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, anti-racism and inclusion in the delivery of its services and in its workplaces. The TTC is committed to fostering a diverse workforce that is representative of the communities it serves at all levels of the organization, and supports an inclusive environment where diverse employee and community perspectives and experiences bring value to the organization. The TTC encourages applications from all applicants, including members of groups with historical and/or current barriers to equity, including but not limited to, Indigenous, Black and racialized groups, people with disabilities, women and people from the LGBTQ(IA+) community. The TTC values and supports an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Accommodations for applicants are available upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process, including for those who identify as having a disability. Please contact Human Resources – Talent Management at 
   (416) 393-4570. Any information received related to an accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
  

   The TTC’s policy prohibits relatives of current TTC employees from being hired, assigned, transferred or promoted into positions, where there is a conflict of interest due to a relationship. Should you be selected for an interview, you will be required to disclose the name, relationship and position of any relative who is a current TTC employee.
  

   Note: All TTC Employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a precondition of employment in accordance with TTC's Mandatory Vaccination Policy
  

   We thank all applicants for their interest but advise only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Technical Analyst - Motorcycles & Power Equipment
Description:
Job Description: The Technical Analyst - Motorcycles & Power Equipment works within the Quality Engineering Department at the Honda Canada National Office (HCI). The purpose of this activity is to drive continuous quality improvement for Honda Canada’s Motorcycle, ATV, SXS, Marine and Power Equipment markets. The incumbent’s purpose is to drive countermeasure activity through market problem identification, parts analysis, and field visits when required.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Conduct data analysis of warranty claims and field reports to define and prioritize quality issues.
Daily review of on-going investigations, forward new information from the market (Dealers, Tech-Line) to all concerned parties in a timely manner.
Conduct warehouse rework campaigns as required: recalls, Product improvement / update campaigns.
QIC Investigation Activity – Technical investigation to understand failure. This involves support required by R&D test teams to Canada, collecting and validation of failed warranty parts and shipment of sample parts to R&D / producing factory.
Initiate or participate in regular quality update meetings (QIC).
Primary support group for technical inquiries coming through Tech-Line, Customer Relations, Dealer Care, and Sales
Generate service publications for dealers, other departments, and zones outlining new and revised repair techniques to address issues identified recently in the market. Repairs validated prior to release of service bulletins.
Attend new product / model Initial Quality Check Events (IQC).

QUALIFICATIONS: 

Bachelor Degree - Engineering
Mechanics License in either Automotive or Motorcycle would be an asset
4 years’ experience in automotive or Motorcycle engineering would be an asset
Strong proficiency in MS Office – Excel, Word, Power Point

Honda Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation will take into account the applicant's accessibility needs.
If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email Human Resources at accessibility@honda.ca or call (905)888-4331.#LI-Hybrid
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Job Location Toronto, Ontario CA 
 Address 10 Roybridge Gate Suite 202 (Vaughan), Ontario L4H 3M8 
 Job Category Purchasing/Pricing 
 ABOUT US (AND OUR EXCITING FUTURE)
Menasha Corporation is all about possibilities. Our two businesses, Menasha Packaging and ORBIS Corporation, are leaders in their industries, providing corrugated and plastic packaging products and related services to major global companies.
Our employees make the difference, proving that great ideas, collaboration and quality turn possibilities into success. Working at Menasha Corporation means that your insights provide cutting-edge solutions for our customers. If you like to make things happen and are passionate about what you do, you’re going to want to be here.
Join us and become part of the power behind possible.
Menasha Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), the company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities and encourages both prospective employees and incumbents to discuss potential accommodations with the employer.



Shift Requirements 1st Shift 
 
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY


Position Summary
 Responsible for pricing of goods and services in order to stay competitive in the market. Conducts market research and makes recommendations regarding pricing policies. Maintains historical pricing data on the organization and its competitors.
    





Essential to this Position

The following duties are normal for this position. The incumbent may perform some or all of these duties however; it is not an exclusive or all- inclusive list. Other duties may be assigned.

Demonstrates a strategic understanding of customer pricing expectations and aligns Menasha pricing models to customer requirements
Performs day to day pricing set up, review and wrap-up on individual quote requests to ensure deliverables are completed on time, within budget and with accuracy
Develops understanding and expertise in pricing functionality on SAP, and shares information and best practices with team for continual improvement
Executes pricing strategies to support customer requirements, works closely with key stakeholders to maximize profitability and maintain systematic accuracy
Executes and assures compliance to company pricing processes, policies, and practices
Performs day to day pricing maintenance – ensuring SAP is configured with accurate and up-to-date information
Must have a high-level understanding of market pricing and guiding principles as it pertains to display and POP materials
Develop an in depth understanding of customer specific pricing templates and will gather all relevant data to ensure pricing templates are completed with accuracy and within customer requirements
Will work with estimating to ensure new bids/ RFQs are completed on time, within customer specification and with adherence to Menasha Packaging Canada pricing methodology
Demonstrates knowledge of Menasha’s products and capabilities to align with customer’s products and objectives
Develops pricing strategies to support requests for proposals working closely with key stakeholders to maximize profitability and meet customer’s requirements
Conducts analysis of planned versus actual performance and profitability for assigned business segments
Interacts with key stakeholders to resolve internal costing or customer pricing discrepancies
Supports continuous improvement initiatives for pricing process and information flow
Prepares and reviews required business reports
Ensures and supports to make sure Food safety, Quality, HACCP and GMP is always followed






EDUCATION / CERTIFICATIONS


Education Required
 Bachelor’s Degree 
   

Education Desired
 Bachelor’s Degree 
   




SKILLS & EXPERIENCE


Work Experience Required
 At least 2 years relevant experience 
   



ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS



Knowledge of and ability to use and influence organization's policies, standards and procedures guiding manufacturing processes 
Knowledge of strategies and tools for controlling and optimizing the factors that lie between the purchase of raw materials and delivery of finished products 
Knowledge or familiarity of SAP or other similar ERP systems preferred 
Ability to effectively manage the business relationship and transactions with the suppliers of raw materials or product components 
Knowledge of issues and considerations for effectively managing local or distributed inventories of raw materials, work in progress and finished goods 
Knowledge of the processes, tools and operational considerations for effective and efficient movement of goods and materials throughout the manufacturing cycle Knowledge of the day-to-day operations of a manufacturing plant or facility 
Proficient computer skills working with spreadsheets in excel





ABOUT MENASHA PACKAGING Join Menasha Packaging (www.menasha.com) where we are all about the power behind possible! Menasha is the industry’s largest independent, retail-focused corrugated packaging, display, and merchandising solutions provider. We design, print, and produce customized packaging, high-end graphic displays, merchandising material, and e-commerce packaging, and we provide pack-out, fulfillment and supply chain services to retailers and leading global consumer packaged goods companies. 
  
 Menasha Packaging, along with ORBIS Corporation (www.orbiscorporation.com), a reusable plastic packaging and supply chain services provider, are companies of Menasha Corporation (www.menashacorporation.com), one of America’s oldest private, family-owned manufacturing companies. With a history of innovation spanning more than 170 years, Menasha Corporation is headquartered in Neenah, Wis., and has 100 locations in North America and Europe. 
  
 You can check out Menasha Corporation’s culture of focusing on employees, operating responsibly, and serving customers in our online Corporate Social Responsibility Report at http://www.insightdigital.biz/i/1272161-2020-social-responsibility-report/0.
  
 Click here to view our two-minute video that shares a quick glimpse about Menasha Corporation and our future of possibilities. 
  
 Join us and become part of the power behind possible.

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
PRICING ANALYST


Cavendish Farms is a leading producer of frozen food products for retail and foodservice markets throughout Canada, the United States, and around the world. We have state-of-the-art potato processing plants in Prince Edward Island, Lethbridge, Alberta, and Jamestown, North Dakota, and an appetizer plant in Wheatley, Ontario. Our Head office is in Dieppe, New Brunswick and has sales office locations in Toronto, Montreal, and Boston. 
Reporting to the Manager, Pricing Analytics, the successful candidate must thrive in a fast paced, ever changing environment while maintaining a high level of professionalism, accuracy and detail.


The Pricing Analyst will be responsible for evaluating sales opportunities through the completion of a P&L. In addition will support the Pricing department in determining new pricing solutions, providing analysis on existing business to optimize profitability, and oversee the on-going maintenance and improvement of existing pricing tools.  Successful Candidate will possess the following qualifications:

Post-secondary education in Finance or Accounting;
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience;
Certified Pricing Professional designation would be considered an asset;
Demonstrated organizational and time management skills;
Understanding / knowledge in Sales would be an asset;
Experience in Altertyx considered an asset
Strong sense of urgency to complete tasks;
Strong analytical skills;
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;
High attention to detail;
Strong computer skills (Microsoft suite).


 Key responsibilities:

Responsible for completing Profit & Loss analysis for new sales opportunities and existing business in a timely manner in order to evaluate and analyze the opportunity and/or the current state of business.
Maintain current sales report as well as providing sales analysis and data on an ad hoc basis.
Works with Sales team to identify, create, and implement pricing strategies in order to improve and maximize profitability.
Responsible for the ongoing maintenance and improvement of pricing processes; identifying new pricing initiatives or areas for improved efficiencies.


 
Cavendish Farms is proud to offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including but not limited to:

A flexible health, drug, dental, and vision plan
Employee & Family Assistance Programs
Health & wellness reimbursements, includes gym memberships, fitness classes or online workout programs
Maternity leave top-up program (if applicable)
RRSP matching program
Opportunities to take part in job related training and development as well as 24/7 access to online curated learning
Growth and progression opportunities
Hybrid Work Schedule (if applicable) to provide you the flexibility to work from home up to 2 days per week


 
For further details, please contact the Talent Acquisition Team at jobs@cavendishfarms.com.


To Apply for this Career Opportunity: Please apply online by July 24th, 2022  We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  To learn more about our products and services, here.   Cavendish Farms Corporation is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.

Title: BUSINESS ANALYST TRANSPORTATION
Description:
Job Category: Finance, Accounting & Purchasing
        

Division & Section: Transportation Services, Business Performance
        

Work Location: 64 Murray Road
        

Job Type & Duration: 2 Permanent, 1 Temporary (12 month) vacancies
        

Salary: $83,228.60 - $97,770.40/year, TM1933, Wage Grade 6
        

Shift Information: 35 hours per week
        

Affiliation: Non-Union
        

Number of Positions Open: 3
        

Posting Period: 12-July-2022 to 10-August-2022
        


About the Role:

Reporting to the Manager of the Performance Management Unit in the Business Performance Section, the Business Analyst will provide data analysis and performance reports. They will plan business activities, provide project management and information management expertise and work on continuous business improvement initiatives.


 

Reporting to the Manager of the IT Strategic and Emergency Planning Unit in the Business Performance Section, the Business Analyst will be part of a larger team implementing and sustaining Work and Asset Management solutions and providing business support for technology systems. The successful candidates will be responsible for the documentation of business requirements and analysis of business processes and procedures supporting various technology systems.


 
Major Responsibilities:



Identifies business trends utilizing real data, prepare and deliver performance measurement reports and visual dashboards to effectively support performance management needs of all divisional units and stakeholders.
Designs and performs data analyses on both qualitative and quantitative initiatives using relevant methodologies and related software applications.
Completes comprehensive business needs assessments, gap analysis, gathering of requirements, and identifies new opportunities in operational processes through interviewing, facilitating requirements gathering workshops, business process mapping, and business process review/re-engineering sessions with stakeholders.
Implements detailed plans and recommends procedures regarding project-specific requirements.
Identifies, analyzes, optimizes and documents business processes, inputs, outputs, and integration points and conducts workflow analysis, business process mapping and modelling.
Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, and decomposes high-level information into detailed needs and requirements.
Identifies problem areas and inefficiencies, determines the root of business problems and offers recommendation for improvements.
Designs, analyzes and documents processes to support planning, staff re-alignment and management decision- making.
Conducts process flow analysis and business process modelling, re-engineering and/or continuous improvement efforts and reviews the potential impact with staff at all levels of the organization.
Prepares, or contributes to the preparation of, business cases, feasibility (including economic, organizational, operational, technical impact) studies, project charters/plans, business requirements, procedures, work instructions, manuals, design documents, user documentation and records management best practices.
Recommends and establishes program objectives, priorities and schedules.
Conducts financial analysis and determines key indicators to measure the effectiveness and efficiencies of service delivery methods and design processes to track those indicators.
Leads special projects and assignments as required.
Delivers presentations to the functional groups management and non-management staff as part of implementation for improvement.
Prepares training materials and trains users. 

Key Qualifications:


Post-secondary education in a discipline pertinent to the job function such as Computer Science, Applied Sciences, Engineering, Statistics, Information Management or Business Administration, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


Extensive experience in data analysis and preparation of performance reports.


Considerable experience documenting business requirements for technology systems.


Considerable experience in facilitating sessions with stakeholders to identify current/optimal processes and business/technical requirements.


Extensive experience in developing, evaluating, documenting and mapping business processes/workflow and procedures, and use of mapping software (e.g. Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) standard, Visio Professional).


Considerable experience working within the project management environment, including related project governance, planning, delivery and methodologies.


Proficient in using a variety of software packages, including MS Office (i.e. Word, Excel and PowerPoint), process design software (e.g. Visio) and project management software (e.g. MS Project).


Solid understanding of the System Development Life Cycle and systems development methodologies.


Ability to design and perform data analysis on both qualitative and quantitative initiatives using relevant methodologies and related software applications.


A team player with excellent written and oral communication, presentation and interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all levels of the organization.


Ability to develop requirements or implement GIS (Geographic Information System), mobile technologies and incorporate spatial data, contract management, cost recovery, service requests and work orders into a new work management system.


Ability to prioritize multiple projects, work with cross-functional teams, set clear directions and design terms of reference and project plans.

Title: Senior Performance Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
The Retail Performance Analytics team is looking for a Senior Performance Analyst. We are seeking a strategic thinker who enjoys working with data, and has excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. As a Senior Performance Analyst on the CTR Performance team, you will help deliver performance insights and recommendations for the Canadian Tire Retail business segment. You will help facilitate data investigations, retail analytics, and create visualization tools in conjunction with our cross-functional teams. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibility embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and/or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
What you’ll do 

Leads regular analyses of sales performance by customer, product, brands, store network, and other relevant factors to establish key performance insights for an executive audience 
Performing analytics, creating models, and reports on retail data to support growth initiatives 
Be strategic and able to identify opportunities to initiate analysis that creates a positive impact on business 
Leverages several sources of data to analyze general as well as specific trends, year-over-year sales, key regional and product differences including relevant competitive information 
Monitors effectiveness of business strategy and prepares executive storyline presentations highlighting key findings and insights in a logical well thought out manners 
Drives efficiencies in regular reporting to allow more time spent on in-depth analyses 
Prepares presentations to show key findings and insights in a logical well-thought-out manner 

What you bring 

Typically, between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to SQL, Power BI, R, Python, Azure Synapse 
Advanced knowledge of data management and visualization 
Excellent verbal & written communication skills with application in influence executive clients with data 
Excellent attention to detail 
In depth analytical and problem-solving skills with a structured approach to analysis and the ability to develop logical arguments 
Passion for digging into quantitative and qualitative data 
Ability to see the bigger picture of the problem you are trying to solve and to proactively seek new data points from varied sources (external and internal) to complement your analysis 
Curiosity and a growth mindset 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . 
#LI-RF1 


  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Finance & Admin 
 

  Ontario-Toronto 
 

  Permanent 
 

  Full-time

Title: Business Analyst (3 month contract)

Title: Business Analyst, Enterprise Products
Description:
Company Description




 Job Description
  We are looking to grow our team! Do you have a passion for Business Analysis? We are currently hiring for a Business Analyst, Enterprise Products to work closely with Business Groups, D&T Resources and 3rd party software vendors to analyze and document requirements for solutions that provide value to our internal and external customers.
 This role is responsible for requirements gathering / analysis and testing for various systems which support our lines of business. This individual will also be responsible for proving 2nd level support on these systems.
 In addition, the successful incumbent will be supporting the Product owners and Business Leads with management of the portfolio roadmaps
 What The Role Is:


 Develop a partnership with the business and understand and document their needs, business processes and requirements


 Work with D&T / 3rd party developers to ensure that delivered solutions match business requirements


 Work with users in diagnosing production issues and doing root cause analysis


 Configure systems as per business requirements


 Collaborate with vendors on learning best practices and configuration details of various systems




 Qualifications
  What Is Required For Success:

 Undergraduate degree in Business or Technology or equivalent experience
 3+ years experience HR / Payroll applications Support
 3+ years experience SharePoint Online / O365 application Support
 3+ years experience in requirements gathering, process mapping and business analysis
 3+ years of experience maintaining and supporting complex software systems

 What Sets You Apart From The Crowd:


 Ability to Lead and Motivate small project teams though a projects life cycle
 Strong knowledge of business analysis – including requirements gathering and business process mapping
 Knowledge of writing SQL queries for data analysis
 Knowledge of reporting and data visualizing tools such as PowerBi and Cognos
 Clear and concise oral and written communication/presentation skills

 Additional Information
  Cineplex (TSX:CGX) is a top-tier Canadian brand that operates in the Film Entertainment and Content, Amusement and Leisure, and Media sectors. A leading entertainment and media company, Cineplex welcomes over 70 million guests annually through its circuit of theatres and location based entertainment venues across the country. In addition to being Canada’s largest and most innovative film exhibitor, Cineplex also operates successful businesses in digital commerce (CineplexStore.com), food service, alternative programming (Cineplex Events), cinema media (Cineplex Media), digital place-based media (Cineplex Digital Media), amusement solutions (Player One Amusement Group) and an online esports platform for competitive and passionate gamers (WorldGaming Network). Additionally, Cineplex operates location based entertainment complexes specially designed for teens and families (Playdium) as well as Canada’s favourite destination for ‘Eats & Entertainment’ (The Rec Room), and will be opening exciting new sports and entertainment venues across Canada (Topgolf). Cineplex is a joint venture partner in SCENE, Canada’s largest entertainment loyalty program.

 Proudly recognized as having one of the country’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, Cineplex employs approximately 13,000 people in its offices across Canada and the United States. To learn more visit Cineplex.com or download the Cineplex App.

 **Candidates are encouraged to review the Cineplex LP Annual Reports or visit www.cineplex.com to learn more about the company **
 Interested applicants please apply today.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst

 Who we are:


 Over the next 25 years, one of the largest transfers of assets will be taking place as over $60T will be transferred from one generation to the next. However, professionals and the families they serve are wholly underserved in their tools to navigate the estate and trust administration process.

 Since launching in 2021, Estateably is the fastest growing estate and trust administration platform serving over 500 firms across Canada with international ambitions. We stay ahead of the curve to be the best at what we do by being the technical experts that our clients can always rely on.

 Our team and vision for the industry's future are bold, ambitious and accessible. The nature of our industry is complex yet sensitive, and we keep that in mind with everything we do.


 What we value:

 Our team is guided by a genuine empathy for our users' problems and pain points, radical honesty and reliable expertise. We love people who are willing to think outside the box and are excited to collaborate with others. We are authentic and know that building a team with diverse backgrounds is critical to our success, so we are committed to providing a respectful, creative and inclusive environment to everyone on our team.

 What you’ll do:

 As a Business Analyst, you will engage with the Project Manager in project planning, monitoring and tracking. As part of the Professional Services team, you will participate in implementations for the customer, configuration of the Estateably platform and assist in functional discussions on the presales cycle.

 What you can expect:


 Contribute to overall project planning and provide the Project Manager all relevant inputs for effective project planning, monitoring and tracking
Drive all design activities related to how the application will be implemented for the customer, including running / contributing to design workshops, documenting the design, identifying gaps and effective resolution strategies, etc.
Deliver comprehensive end-user training & support to business users of all levels
 Configure the Estateably platform
 Contribute, as required, to producing appropriate documentation, including End User Documentation
 Assist in technical/functional discussions, estimating projects, and providing product demonstrations as part of the presales cycle.
 Collaborate with cross-functional peers to establish and maintain organizational best practices, processes and methodologies


 Desired skill set:


 Degree in Business, Engineering or MIS
 Excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
 Minimum 1 - 3 years of experience in software implementations or a comparable role.
 Knowledge of data relationships
 Enjoy collaboration in a team environment
 Strong multitasking and time management skills



 Experience with some of the following would be an asset:



Javascript
REST APIs
JSON
Experience working with integrations
Experience working with Cloud-Native environments



 What we are looking for:



Willingness and ability to learn fast.
High work ethic and results-oriented.
High sense of accountability and ownership.


 Perks:



Be a part of a fast-growing startup.
Flexible hours & remote/hybrid work.
Participation in our company employee Stock Option Plan.
Yearly bonus based on performance.
Full participation in our company’s group health, dental, and virtual medicine plans.
Full financial support for professional (work-related) development courses.
Wellness stipend
Work-from-home stipend.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Calculations
Description:
Why you’ll love working here:
 



     high-performance, people-focused culture
   


     our commitment that equity, diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our work environment and business success, which helps employees feel valued and empowered to be their authentic selves
   


     learning and development initiatives, including workshops, Speaker Series events and access to LinkedIn Learning, that support employees’ career growth
   


     competitive, 100% company-paid extended health and dental benefits for permanent employees with recent additions to promote inclusive coverage to a diverse employee population. These recent additions include gender affirmation and fertility drug and treatment coverage
   


     membership in HOOPP’s world class defined benefit pension plan, which can serve as an important part of your retirement security
   


     access to an annual wellness reimbursement program for health and wellness-related expenses for permanent employees
   


     virtual fitness, yoga and meditation classes, nutritional consultations and wellness seminars
   


     we offer a hybrid flexible work model that embraces remote work in Ontario for eligible roles
   


     the opportunity to make a difference and help take care of those who care for us, by providing a financially secure retirement for Ontario healthcare workers
   



   Job Summary:
 


   The Sr. Calculations Analyst (“Sr. Analyst”) is primarily responsible for ensuring that quality is inherent in all HOOPP processes by supporting the mandate of the Operations Support and Actuarial Services area. The position requires technical expertise to perform an in-house review of all technical questions regarding calculations by applying the use of the Plan Text and internal policies from the Plan Operations business. This role also requires the preparation and/or review of all off-system calculations not performed on the administration system, assistance with certain individual member benefit costings, analysis and summary of certain demographic populations with known calculation defects (including summarizing resulting calculation details and preparation of presentation material), assistance in modelling individual member calculations in support of the proposed Plan changes and Plan design.
 


   From time to time the role will require coordination with other areas of Operations Support (such as Data, Policy, and Operational Controls), Client Services, and PSG Pension Solutions Group (specifically QA/UAT).
 


   What you will do:
 


   Support the Actuarial Solutions team with the following:
 



     All off-system calculations by either reviewing or preparing for reviewing the calculation details and any corresponding information required to be managed through the business process
   


     Recommending enhancements to calculation standards and procedures for all off-system tools and the preparation of internally-produced actuarial materials for internal meetings
   


     Being a resource to other areas of Plan Operations for ongoing operations and for special projects when they arise from time to time
   


     Working with the internal HOOPP audit group as required
   



   Support the Member Services Team with the following:
 



     Conduct during processing reviews of cases including review of calculation methodologies, to ensure overall accuracy and quality of member files
   


     Conduct production validation of QAMs for off-system processing
   


     Analyze data to identify quality issues
   


     Prepare statistics reports summarizing and analysing findings
   


     Provide recommendations for corrections (in accordance with applicable corrections policies), where applicable
   


     Recommend improvements to methodologies as applicable
   


     Liaise with Client Services as applicable
   



   Support the Cyclical Processes, Payroll and Data team with the following:
 



     Accountable for calculation support and audit for cyclical processes (Salary Indexing, COLA, Annual Calculations, Annual Statements, COLA Statements)
   


     Available to support data quality, actuarial and pre/post audit as required
   


     Perform data validations to ensure correctly imported to Ariel DB and can be used for calculation purposes
   


     Be a resource when information is needed on how data is stored in Insight/Ariel DB/Ariel Payroll
   



   Accountable for business specifications and coordination relating to special projects including but not limited to benefit improvement, mergers, data health assessments, demographic studies, etc.
 


   Product Support - Analyse complex production problems related to system implementations and releases, troubleshoot for system limitations, report and escalate issues through appropriate channels
 


   Maintain a standard of information sharing
 



     Ensure other team members are up to date on any issues/workarounds/process flow changes, etc. regarding event processing
   


     Maintain contact with the Client Services Team, Training Team, Data Integration Team and other Operational Support teams as required
   



   Maintain actuarial tools and documentation and processes for purposes of on and off-system calculations. Update iKNOW with information related to calculation procedures and actuarial pages
 


   Collaborate with other divisions of the organization, including middle to senior management, to provide direction, advice, training and recommendations for improvements/resolution on Plan provisions, administrative policy, legislative and issues that fall outside set policies and procedures, and difficult, unusual or precedent-setting cases
 


   Proactively provide feedback and escalate issues, as appropriate, to the Manager
 



     Participate in weekly project status reports
   


     Provide ongoing training and mentoring of team members
   


     Prepare and provide monthly and quarterly statistics for the Manager
   



   What you bring:
 



     University degree in actuarial science, math or statistics or a combination of equivalent training, education and experience
   


     Five years of progressive experience in the pension industry with at least four years at a pension benefits specialist/analyst level
   


     Solid knowledge and exposure to pension plan administration and governing legislation and regulations, Pension Benefits Act, Income Tax Act, Family Law Act, Employment Standards Act and other general pension principles
   


     Sound understanding of systems and Microsoft applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and relevant HOOPP or external administration software applications
   


     Ability to transfer knowledge to other members of the calculation team
   


     The ability to build, maintain and update spreadsheet calculations/tools is imperative for this role
   


     Excellent mathematical skills, analytical and problem-solving skills
   


     Team player with good interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
   


     Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills and a high degree of independence and initiative
   


     Strong analytical and technical data mining skills
   


     Effective verbal and report writing communication skills
   


     Ability to work effectively with multiple stakeholders and influence without direct authority

Title: Data and Process Analyst
Description:

Our corporate culture encourages teamwork, service excellence, creativity, and initiative. We are currently hiring for a full–time Data & Process Analyst to join our Client Experience team in Burlington.

In this role you will assist the data team to design, develop, and implement automation/scripting solutions that improve back office efficiency and enhance the client experience of our Advisors. In order to do this, you will utilize data and operations optimization methodologies in order to identify areas in which we can leverage technology and reduce manual processes.

Define configuration specifications analysis requirements
Perform quality assurance

develop automated reporting and alerting solutions
Own and develop relationship with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our integration
Helps design, document and maintain system processes

Constantly be on the lookout for way to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the client

 You will Bring

Title: Energy and Sustainability Analyst
Description:
Is purposeful climate work in your future? Is your career pursuit in the built environment? Are you energized by seeing the direct impact of your work? Do you want to work with and learn from the best building science experts in Energy and Sustainability? Read on.The Energy and Sustainability Analyst’s primary role includes whole building energy and carbon modelling, market research, report writing and presentation development to support projects focused on energy and carbon emission reduction related to the built environment. With a large team of project managers and technical staff, you can expect to support projects focused on net zero carbon, net zero energy, Passive House, deep energy retrofits, LEED®, policy development, and market studies, while creating energy models and analyzing the holistic impact of design decisions from both an energy, carbon and financial perspective.Your contribution will be fundamental to addressing the climate emergency.WHY WE NEED THIS POSITION: Our clients are eager to reduce the environmental impact of buildings. Energy and carbon emission modelling, and financial modelling are often a catalyst for change in how buildings are designed, constructed, and operated. With a deep understanding of how buildings consume energy and emit carbon, backed by comprehensive analysis, we have the opportunity to steer the climate conversation throughout the life of a project. As more and more public and private entities look to reduce their impact, the need for such exploration is mounting.WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR: This is an entry-level opportunity for someone who enjoys working the details for precision and insight and who has strong interest in energy efficiency, climate adaptation and mitigation. We seek someone who values teams and will collaborate well with various project managers and technical staff on multiple projects, switching gears as needed in a fast-paced environment. If you are a continuous learner, organized, love spreadsheets and data science, and can deep dive into data analysis and problem solve, we’d love to hear from you.NOW IN 6 BURSTS: 

Experience: Bachelor or Masters degree in an engineering or building science related field preferred; or, previous experience in building design or construction-related field. 1-2 years experience is asset.
Bonus Experience: Experience with energy modelling software such as eQuest, EnergyPlus, and/or DesignBuilder, Passive House Planning Package or WUFIPassive, data science or scripting tools (e.g. Python).
Special Skills:  Understanding of building science, heat transfer, and thermodynamics fundamentals, related to energy efficient building technologies.
Passion: Work with a team of project managers and technical specialists to influence change through energy and carbon analysis.
Role: Whole building energy, carbon and financial modelling; research, report, and presentation development. Visit existing buildings to investigate building systems and operation to perform energy efficiency assessments for retrofits.
Attributes: Listen and seek first to understand, life-long learner, communicate clearly, get results, curious, questioning, detail-oriented, organized, and analytical.

ABOUT US: RDH is an amazing place to work. A role with RDH is a career commitment to learn and grow alongside inspiring and dedicated people who care deeply about Making Buildings Better.We are an employee-owned consulting firm with 300 employees in nine offices across North America. Our core area of business is the integration of building science engineering, architecture, and construction management to optimize the performance of buildings. Since our beginnings in 1997, we have become industry leaders in North America and continue to grow as we focus on technical excellence and delivering high-quality projects.We offer a positive workplace with incredible teams, opportunities for professional growth, development and ownership. As well as your background, we seek alignment with RDH’s core values: 1) commit to excellence, 2) act with integrity, 3) work as a team 4) do what it takes, and 5) always learn.Our collaborative teams fuel our mission of Making Buildings Better. We seek diversity in our teams and embrace inclusivity. We are committed to equity through building teams based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate in our employment practices.Additional information on our expertise, projects, and culture can be found at www.rdh.com.HOW TO APPLY: Please submit your resume and cover letter in one PDF to hr@rdh.com with the job title and location in the subject line.No phone calls please. While we appreciate all responses, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that only those already entitled to work in Canada legally and permanently need apply.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
Elicit and analyze Business requirements and create documentation such as current and future state business process, user stories, data catalogues, business rules, use cases and user interface design. Contribute to requirements prioritization and leverage techniques to drive out priorities and meet quarterly and annual business objectives. Work collaboratively with our business partners and stakeholders from multiple IT teams (i.e. source systems). Analyze and review different options for data integration and provide recommendations on the solution; such as assessing and defining materiality of data quality issues and possible impact to project objectives. Contribute to data model and system architecture decisions Incorporate enterprise standard requirements methodology in requirements planning, analysis and documentation. Manage performance through regular coaching discussions, providing transparency on where the employees are at from a performance perspective. Support User Acceptance Testing by supporting planning, development of test cases and execution of tests Communicate effectively, written and verbal, to various audiences (technical and non-technical) Banking/Wealth management/Insurance domain knowledge and hands on experience is must. 
 


  Please drop your resume here: moumita@apptoza.com or contact me -
  289-872-0883 ASAP, will get back to you.

Title: IT Business Analyst (Contractor)
Description:
Keyera Career Opportunity
 


   Job Type:
  Independent Contractor
 

   Join our energetic, constantly growing team to provide essential services for oil and gas producers in western Canada! KEYERA is one of the largest and most reliable operators in Canada. Be part of the transformation as we continue to refine our processes in all aspects of gathering, processing, storing, and marketing natural gas liquids throughout North America. It’s your enthusiasm, innovation and talent that will contribute to driving our continued success.
 


   RESPONSIBILITIES
 

   The IT Business Analyst’s role is to be the main point of contact and drive the project forward to implement a source to pay initiative resulting in efficiencies across the Finance, Accounting, and Supply Chain groups at Keyera. This includes working closely with the Project Manager, internal stakeholders, and the IT Corporate Systems teams to map data, processes, assess alternative solutions, and determine requirements for an RFP.
 


   This position is an integral part of our business, contributing to our daily success with the following duties:
 

 Build and maintain a strong working relationship with the internal business stakeholders in the areas of Finance, Supply Chain Management, Field Operations.
 Gather, analyze, and map data to build “As-Is” process workflows and data conversion strategies.
 Be part of the solution for the “To-Be” process workflow to be included in the RFP requirements.
 Assess alternative solutions and recommend future system structure for RFP.
 Review and develop selection criteria for vendor RFP submissions.
 Provide insights and recommendations in the RFP process.
 Prepare documentation and training to assist end users with the efficient intended use of the applications.
 Active participation in supply chain community and/or demonstrated awareness of leading supply chain practices.
 Ability to provide accurate time, cost, and scope of work recommendations to implement solutions arising throughout the project.
 Drive business case analysis to support initial investment.



   QUALIFICATIONS
 

 Business Analyst Certification
 University degree in Business Management, Finance or Supply Chain



   SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
 

 6+ years' working as a Business Analyst
 Expert at creating process maps and data models
 Experience working on large scale projects implementing solutions for Supply Chain, Accounts Payable or IT departments
 Able to develop and interpret technical documentation for training and end user procedures
 Experience with Accounting and Supply Chain including the systems and applications such as Maximo, Qbyte, Open Invoice or Coupa
 Sufficient technical knowledge to understand enterprise architecture and integrations between multiple systems and applications
 Understanding of midstream energy companies is considered an asset
 Certified Lean Black Belt and/or Supply Chain Management Professional (CSCMP) is a preference



   PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES
 

 Team Player that is highly self-motivated
 Strong customer service orientation
 Analytical with problem-solving abilities
 Effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a constantly changing environment
 Ability to present ideas in a business-friendly language
 Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentational skills



   WORK CONDITIONS
 

 Calgary Office with occasional travel to Western Canada field locations is required on an ad hoc basis



   Posting Expiry Date:
  Jul 28, 2022
 

   Keyera embraces diversity and inclusion and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows every person to bring their whole self to work.
 


   Keyera prioritizes the health, safety and wellbeing of workers. As a condition of employment, Keyera requires workers to be compliant with applicable health and safety policies. Candidates are advised that Keyera has indefinitely suspended its Workplace COVID-19 Vaccination Policy (the “Policy”), however, the Policy may come into effect again in the future. If the Policy is resumed, the successful candidate may be required to provide proof of vaccination. Workers who are unable to be fully vaccinated may be eligible for accommodation.
 


   If you are interested in an opportunity to join a winning culture that fosters innovative thinking, open communication, integrity, and mutual respect then you'll enjoy your career with us!
 


   We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Title: SAP Master Data Analyst
Description:
Req id: 29917 
    







     Richmond Hill, ON, CA 
     Mississauga, ON, CA 
     Waterloo, ON, CA
     










OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY

 As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.
     



Life At Opentext:




      At OpenText and in IT, we believe in every employee having meaningful, purposeful work. By joining our team, you will join a community of supportive and collaborative peers focused on innovation, teamwork, and driving successful outcomes. You’ll be expected to bring with you an ideation and “Yes, if” mindset. And, as you build your network and demonstrate your professional excellence, you will have the opportunity to forge your own career path and professional growth.
     



The Opportunity:




      OpenText is looking for a candidate with strong SAP master data background and data analysis skills to be part of a diverse team with a focus on projects relating to data governance, master data architecture and management.
     



      As the Senior Data Analyst, your role is to be the expert in master data structure, design, governance and use across the organization. You will be working on data migration projects that deal with legacy master data from our acquired companies (M&A) into OpenText systems, ensuring business requirements are met and business processes are aligned. The primary objects you would focus on include Vendor master and its multiple attributes, banking rules, P2P processes. You will need to understand the flow and impact of master data objects to downstream systems and other transactional objects. You should be able to work with cross functional business as well as IT teams and be able to share the data analysis across these teams.
     



What You Will Do :




Deep understanding the SAP ERP master data ecosystem, including the fields, tables, and types of transactions which use the master data.
Understanding of data integrations, specifically how master data from SAP can impact downstream systems.
Understanding the Procure to Pay (P2P) is a must-have. 
Experience with a Vendor Management System such as Ariba
Knowledge of Orders to Cash (O2C) and Record to Report (R2R) business streams is an asset.
Building and maintaining cross-functional relationships, including aligning opinions and approaches across disparate teams.
Using Excel for advanced data manipulations and analysis.


Assisting with designing business processes to be aligned to the master data 
Creating or contributing to SOPs for the operational team.
Ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and completeness.





What It Takes:




8+ years working with SAP or a similar ERP for maintaining master data, OR, a combination of master data management/governance experience and experience within Procure to Pay (P2P), or Orders to Cash (O2C),Record to Report (R2R) business streams.
Experience with data migrations and integrations
Advanced Excel skills to perform data manipulations and analysis.
Knowledge and experience with master data tools such as SAP MDG, Data Services, Information Steward; 
General understanding of project lifecycle & development 
Excellent collaboration skills
Ensure adherence to change control process
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field or a combination of education and equivalent experience
7+ years of providing data solutions in a similar setting. 
10+ years IT experience
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills





      OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com.
     



      Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Principal Analyst and Manager, Risk Analytics and Innovation Network
Company: Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada
Description:
Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada - Applied Risk Research and Analytics 
    Vancouver (British Columbia), Ottawa (Ontario), Toronto (Ontario), Montréal Island (Québec) 
    RE-05, RE-06 
    Indeterminate 
    $92,600 to $141,900 (RE-05: $92,600 - $119,300; RE-06: $109,700 - $141,900) 
   For further information on the organization, please visit Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada
Closing date: 2 August 2022 - 23:59, Pacific Time 
Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada, and Canadian citizens and Permanent residents abroad. 
   Apply online


Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
 Assessment accommodation

  POSITION LOCATION:
   The positions are located in Toronto; however, the successful candidate may work from one of the OSFI offices across Canada (Toronto, Montreal, Ottawa, or Vancouver).
  
 As a result of the global pandemic, OSFI employees are currently working from home. Should the current telework environment no longer apply, and contingent on the operating model adopted by OSFI, you may be required to report into and work onsite from one of the following offices: Toronto, Montreal, Ottawa, or Vancouver. As our telework arrangements are evolving, we encourage you to apply.
  
 EMPLOYMENT EQUITY: 
   OSFI is committed to achieving a representative workforce that reflects the diversity of the Canadian population. We are dedicated to building and promoting a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce, representative of all Canadians regardless of race, ethnicity, colour, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, socio-economic background or lived experience. By embracing diversity and inclusion, our department ensures broader discussions, better decisions, and a more positive workplace.
  
 We invite you to be part of the change by joining an organization where individual differences are recognized, valued and respected. We welcome all candidates to apply and strongly encourage candidates to self-declare if they belong to an Employment Equity designated group Aboriginal* Peoples, Persons with Disabilities, Women or Visible Minorities (Black people and other racialized groups).
  


The term “Aboriginal” is used within this job advertisement as it relates to the Employment Equity Act and other legislative frameworks. The term “Indigenous” is used where possible, in alignment with the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples.

 Achieving a representative and diverse workforce has been identified as an organizational need for OSFI and may be applied at any time during this appointment process. If this criterion is used, only those who have indicated that they are members of the specified designated group(s) will be considered. As such, first consideration for an appointment may be given to candidates who self-declare as belonging to one of the four designated employment equity groups (Persons with a disability, Aboriginal people, Members of a Visible Minority, or Women). 
  
 In order to self-declare, please ensure to check off the appropriate box within the online application under the Employment Equity section. We encourage you to consult theses links to learn more about employment equity and self-declaration:
  

https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/gc-jobs/employment-equity.html 
https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/gc-jobs/applying-government-canada-jobs-how-to-apply.html#EE


Duties

   The Principal Analyst, Risk Analytics & Innovation Network (RAIN) will play an important role within the Applied Risk Research and Analytics function at OSFI. This position will develop solutions to utilize the large pools of data held within OSFI in order to extract themes, trends, and emerging risks. Leveraging a mix of data engineering and data analytics skills, and in collaboration with partners across the enterprise, the Principal Analyst will:
  


Gather and understand data requirements and develop reporting solutions using Power BI reports/dashboards, programming and application of modern analytical techniques such as Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.
Consult with staff in other units to determine the appropriate approaches for data platforms and participate in the design and implementation of new reporting.
Collaborate with Technology and Data Management teams to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Gather, prepare and transform data by creating ETL processes using data engineering tools for regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Provide advice and guidance to assigned stakeholders on implementation of analytical and reporting solutions.
Apply automation and innovation on new and on-going data platforms for BI projects aligned to business or organizational strategies.
Identify, design and implement process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery and re-designing processes and infrastructure for greater scalability.
Conduct research and evaluation of new analytical tools and methodologies.
Manage competing priorities simultaneously and drive projects to completion.
Provide status updates, presentations, recommendations and respond to enquiries from division management.

 The Manager, Risk Analytics & Innovation Network (RAIN) will, in addition to the above,
  

Play a leadership role within the Applied Risk Research and Analytics function at OSFI. This will include taking on increased responsibilities to lead projects and staff through initiation to resolution, identifying and resolving constraints and impediments to the successful resolution of risk initiatives, and presenting to senior leadership. 
Manage the intake, planning, and prioritization of requests, working with stakeholders and senior leadership to prioritize, lead and manage each initiative.
Work to continuously improve the request intake process to ensure the best use of resource time and help to manage stakeholder expectations through regular updates and resolution of competing priorities.
Assign appropriate tasks to team members when acting as lead.

 This is an exciting opportunity to join a new, mission-critical function within OSFI. If you are a passionate data and analytics practitioner looking to make an impact through innovation and technology – please apply within!
 
Work environment

   Our Role:
   OSFI is an independent federal government agency that regulates and supervises more than 400 federally regulated financial institutions and 1,200 pension plans to determine whether they are in sound financial condition. In fulfilling its mandate, OSFI supports the government's objective of contributing to public confidence in the Canadian financial system. 
   Learn more about us https://youtu.be/QO_3vnPKuZI 
  
 Our People and Culture:
   People are the foundation of our organization. You will become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone has varied experience and fosters an environment where communication and teamwork amplify our effectiveness. We have several networks dedicated to ensuring that the department continues to grow as an inclusive, accessible, respectful and diverse workplace. All employees are encouraged and welcome to join the following networks and participate in their activities and events.
  

Diversity of Thought
Family Responsibilities 
Gender
LGBTQ2IS
Mental Health and Accessibility 
Multiculturalism (Affinity Groups: Indigenous, Asian, Black)
Unconscious Bias 
Hear about our people https://youtu.be/diUspmpYWQI 
  
 Our Rewards: 
   Compensation: OSFI offers a competitive salary, and employees may be eligible for in-range increases and economic adjustments. Salaries are based on qualifications, experience and knowledge. The Public Service Pension Plan is a defined benefits pension plan (indexed for inflation), where both the employer and the employee contribute. 
  
 Performance Pay: OSFI employees are eligible for an annual bonus based on their performance throughout the year.
  
 ✈️ Vacation and Leave: OSFI employees start with 4 weeks of paid vacation, 2 personal days and 5 days of Family Related Leave with Pay among other various types of paid and unpaid leave.
