Title: Data & Business Analyst
Description:
Title: Data & Business Analyst 


Location: Toronto, ON 


Type: Contract 

 Purpose 

 To assist in the planning of statistical collection and analysis activities in support of various educational programs and policy initiatives related to elementary and secondary school education. To design and develop systems for collecting, validating, maintaining and processing data in support of large-scale assessments. To collect, analyze, summarize and disseminate relevant data on educational topics for use by internal staff, ministry stakeholders, and educational institutions. 

 Key Responsibilities 
1. Data Management 
Plans, coordinates and provides data management support and technical advice regarding the processing and analysis of large-scale assessment data. 
Developing processes to ensure data quality (e.g., integrity, accuracy, and completeness). 
Designing guidelines and protocols to facilitate the data lifecycle processes; sharing these developments with relevant staff. 
Participates in the development, monitoring and enforcement of protocols to maintain data and information for data sharing and to ensure data integrity. 

 2. Data Analysis 
Leads and coordinates the analysis of data as well as the implementation of data quality assurance policies and procedures. 
Verifies identified solutions have been accurately applied and reflect specifications and requirements. 
Defining data needs to reflect information requirements to meet its business and policy needs. 
Coordinates and ensures data security and confidentiality for assigned projects. 
Identifies, recommends, and implements improvements to data processing systems. 

 3. Stakeholder Relations, Advice and Support 
Develops and maintains contacts with key internal and external stakeholders groups to enable consultation and collaboration on research endeavors and to provide/exchange research data and results. 
Provides support to internal working groups involved in data analysis and reporting, and participates in, and/or leads stakeholder consultation processes. 
Receives, processes, and distributes data requests from internal and external stakeholders 

 Knowledge / Skill 


Knowledge of and skills in:
 Theory, principles and concepts of data structures, database design and information retrieval, data architecture, and programming languages (e.g., SQL, R) to coordinate data management and analysis related projects/tasks/activities. 
Information management practice and processes, data warehousing and use of business intelligence (BI) tools, data retrieval and analysis systems techniques to manage and conduct in-depth analyses, to develop reports and provide guidance and statistical advice. 
Project management to plan and coordinate the design, development and implementation of systems, databases, and procedures of large-scale assessments. 
Oral and written communications to provide information and advice to senior management, and/or other internal/external stakeholders. 
Presentation skills to disseminate technical, research, and other reports. 

 Identify and evaluate sources of data for research purposes, assess and select mathematical/statistical methods, investigate and assess new technologies required to support business processes, and prepare statistical analyses. 
Develop project plans to support the development and implementation of database systems and analyses. 
Understand and develop solutions to meet business needs when working with large scale information systems and data sets 
Planning, coordinating and providing technical expertise for the development of data systems and procedures for large scale assessment projects. 
Monitoring the performance of existing processes and databases and proposing solutions to improve the quality of data collected. 
Providing technical and project leadership in the design, development and implementation of databases. 
Providing research and drafting reports/options analyses to assist with end-user goals. 
Has input to determine research and analysis approaches, method of data presentation, identify and recommend data systems for project 
requirements. 

 Apply now!!! We look forward to working with you!!! 

 #LI-KS1 

 INDHuntelGlobalToronto

Title: Asset Management Analyst
Description:
The role of Asset Management Analyst who will work in conjunction with the Solution Manager, is to manage the full life cycle of the IS&T applications supporting the different Asset Mgmt processes and to optimize them to bring the most value to BRP. The job holder will also be involved in the idea management process(continuous improvement) with all manufacturing sites: recommending improvements to answer customer needs and optimizing each platform; taking advantage of its current and future functionalities. The Functional Analyst needs to have a thorough functional knowledge of all the applications they will be in charge of. 

 YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

 Manage the application lifecycle of a portion of the order to delivery application portfolio (CMMS (Maintenance), Calibrations, BMS, EMS (Building, Facility, Energy Management systems), Inventory. 

 Collaborate with the different development teams in charge of those platforms and facilitate their interactions with the other IS/IT Teams (Server, Network, Telecom, CyberSecurity, PMO, etc…). 

 Maintain the application register for the domain with associated site exceptions, required upgrades, risks, and opt-in opportunities, including some basic documentation for critical applications (RunBook). 

 Manage and optimize the number of licenses for each application (Hardware, Middleware, Software). 

 Participate in the idea management process and in the Centre of Excellence for Manufacturing Improvement Delivery Model with the different BRP sites. 

 Participate in new projects to evaluate and select best tools / applications / scenarios for new business needs in tight collaboration with the business stakeholders, project teams, solution architects and solution managers. 

 Elaborate, document, and follow use cases on projects related to your applications. 

 Ensure quality of projects delivered for your applications 

 Be involved in establishing and maintaining standards for development, test, and release management 

 YOUR QUALIFICATIONS 

 A bachelor's degree, college degree or associate’s degree in industrial production, industrial engineering, computer science, information systems, or a related field, or equivalent project-related experience. 

 A minimum of three years of experience in information systems (support, configurations, improvements, system deployments ,supporting manufacturing and/or maintenance operations). 

 Experience in business relationship management and project management would be an asset. 

 ASSETS 


Knowledge of maintenance domain: planning, affection, spare parts Mgmt, Predictive, etc. 


Knowledge of the life cycle of assets : capitalization, qualification, depreciation, decommissioning. 

 Knowledge of systems surrounding manufacturing operations such as ERP(SAP), MES, PLM(TeamCenter), manufacturing business processes and tools/functionalities. 

 Knowledge of data analytics tools (SQL, PowerBI, Excel). 

 Knowledge of LowCode platforms (PowerApps, PowerAutomate, Mendix, etc). 

 YOUR SKILLS 

 Bilingual in French and English. 

 Strong analytical skills. 

 Excellent communication skills . 

 Organized, meticulous and attention to details. 

 Strong judgment skills. 

 Self-starter and autonomous. 

 Accountability. 

 Strong continuous innovation skills. 

 Team player with leadership and collaborative skills to deal with cross-functional teams ensuring successful delivery of solutions. 

 WELCOME TO BRP 

 We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey. Yours. 

 #LI-BB1

Title: Business Analyst, Renew OperationsSystems - Data Analytics
Description:
Working with the Delivery Manager, Renew Operations Systems (ROS), the Business Analyst will support Teck’s business transformation program – RACE21™. This BA role will be working on Business Intelligence projects (Reporting & Analytics) to enable coordinated planning within our mining operations. The BA’s key deliverables include a definition of business outcomes for reporting, translating these into requirements then performing business process analysis to understand information flow and mapping of source data requirements.

 Responsibilities:


 Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures
 Work closely with key partners to prioritize requirements and communicate different messages optimally to different audiences
 Develop & maintain artifacts describing traceability of data from source to KPI ensuring that business requirements for reporting are met
 Liaison between business, operations, and technology and innovation teams to accurately gather, analyze, document, and deliver business requirements
 Adapts to changing business priorities and business needs during active design periods; and can keep Requirement Definitions and other documentation updated accordingly


 Qualifications:


 Senior Business Analyst with 10+ years of Business Analyst or other equivalent strategic planning proficiencies
 Must-have skills & experience implementing intelligence and reporting solutions
 Mapping business processes to data to identify data sources and information flow
 Define business goals and objectives and translate these into solution requirements
 Project experience in complex environments, including multi-functional, international, or cross-organizational teams and partners
 Resource industry business solution project experience across multiple sites, including field operations, head office, and regional offices.
 Business analysis experience including business case development, requirements documentation, business process analysis (current & future state), and implementation planning
 Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, Teams
 Outstanding communications (verbal and written) skills
 Resource industry experience is required with experience in mining considered an asset
 Proficient in English
 Spanish is considered an asset
 Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


 Successful candidates must be fully vaccinated against infection by COVID-19. Candidates who are unable to be vaccinated due to a personal characteristic protected under applicable human rights legislation may request to be exempt from this requirement. We will do our best to accommodate those who are unable to be vaccinated.

 About Teck
 At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution.

 We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
 Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, zinc, and energy. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK. A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

 The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck’s approach to business. Teck is building partnerships and the capacity to confront sustainability challenges within the regions in which it operates and at the global level. In 2018, Teck was named to the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI) for the ninth straight year, indicating that Teck’s sustainability practices rank in the top 10 percent of the world’s 2,500 largest public companies in the S&P Global Broad Market Index.

Title: Credit Analyst
Description:
Be visionary
 


   At Teledyne FLIR, we have a simple but ambitious mission: to develop market-leading thermal and sensing technologies which enhance everyday life. From saving energy, to saving lives Teledyne FLIR is making a real difference in our world.
  
 Our products are used in a wide array of situations to rescue people in danger, detect criminals, conserve energy, navigate safely, provide security around the globe, and protect our environment.
 


   We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.
 


 Job Description
 


 Job Summary:
 

   FLIR Integrated Imaging Solutions (IIS), a division of Teledyne, headquartered in the Greater Vancouver area, BC, addresses mainly 2 growing markets: Machine vision for the largest part of our activities, and People Flow Analytics.
 


   Regarding Machine Vision: we provide to machinery manufacturers or system integrators imaging products and solutions that are used for quality inspection, measurement, traceability, vision guided automation and robotics, as well as intelligent traffic systems. Regarding People Analytics: we are currently focused on Retail Analytics, and we provide imaging products and solutions that are used to measure retail customers traffic, customers queuing time, customers flow in the retail space; Essentially our People Analytics products help to replicate the equivalent of web analytics in the physical world.
 


   We are looking to find a Credit Analyst to support the FLIR IIS division, part of Teledyne’s Commercial Business Unit. Teledyne hires on passion and drive to succeed! The Credit Analyst position will be responsible for assisting in all phases of the Credit and Collections process. As the single-point owner of an Accounts Receivable portfolio, this position will partner with customers, key members of the Sales team and Customer Service organizations in support of the IIS’s financial objectives of profitable sales growth and meeting collection targets.
 


   This position will involve a variety of cross-functional projects that drive efficiencies and improve collections.
 


   Primary Duties & Responsibilities:
 

 Manage A/R within established customer credit limits
 Maximize sales and minimize bad debt on assigned customer portfolio
 Conduct annual credit reviews on large and existing customers
 Process credit applications, obtain credit reports and conduct bank and trade investigations
 Assess credit risk; analyze customer financial statements
 Recommend suitable credit limits for management approval
 Provide financial order management support to Sales, Customer Order Services and Repair departments to control credit exposure, effect timely payment, and minimize risk of customer disputes
 Approve and negotiate customer orders for shipment
 Meet cash collection targets
 Monitor and respond appropriately to changes in customer’s ability to pay
 Conduct detailed account reconciliations to resolve problems, chargebacks and/or disputes in a timely manner
 Experience with data analysis, problem-solving and solutions
 Maintain accurate electronic collection notes for each account
 Update Credit Manager for preparation of the monthly Significant Accounts Report
 Maintain Customer Credit Master file
 Provide customer service and develops relationships with internal/external customers
 Communicate Credit & Collection Department and company payment policies to customers and company personnel



   Job Qualifications:
 

 BS/BA degree in Accounting/Finance preferred
 Extremely proficient in Microsoft Office including Excel
 SAP experience strongly desired
 Knowledgeable with Letters of Credit
 Ability to work in high pressure, fast-paced environment
 Must have excellent professional, verbal and written skills
 Able to communicate effectively with all levels and areas of business and customers



   Eligible to be certified to examine, possess, and transfer items under the Canadian Controlled Goods Program and legally authorized to work in Canada
 


 Teledyne FLIR and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.
 


   Teledyne FLIR is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Analyst, Sales Compensation Operations
Description:
Our Company
  
 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
  
 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
 


 At Adobe, we’re changing the world. How? We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more meaningful. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers by efficiently managing experiences across channels (Web, Mobile, Social, in-store etc.) as well as across brands and geographies. We're the ones behind the gorgeously designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and we’re the ones who harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight and insight to action by delivering content that people crave most.
 


   We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders throughout the organization. If you’re passionate about leading from where you sit, join us.
 

   Adobe is looking for a Sales Compensation Analyst who will be responsible for supporting the compensation needs of our global sales organization. You will play an integral role in Adobe's ongoing compensation strategy by processing results, implementing Adobe controls, assigning quotas and providing ongoing support for the commissionable employees in the field.
 


   Responsibilities:
 

 Handle commission results autonomously and continuously seek to improve existing processes
 Maintain controls required for accurate payout of commissions
 Lead quota and territory assignment and ongoing alignment
 Collaborate with our finance partners to provide accurate and timely payments to field employees
 Timely and accurate resolution of commissions questions/disputes from field employees
 Develop, maintain and update systems and processes critical to the reporting and tracking of compensation and sales team metrics
 Develop and present business insights to Sales Operations management
 Maintain and help run the sales incentive compensation processes
 Collaborate with Sales Operations and Sales Leadership to improve compensation plan design
 Guide special projects, such as data analysis, process improvement, report building, commissions modeling


   What you’ll need to succeed:
 

 BA/BS in Finance, Economics, Business Administration or related degree
 4+ years experience in an analyst role in sales compensation, FP&A, or sales operations at a high-growth technology company with recurring revenue (SaaS)
 Experience working with Salesforce.com
 Strong analytical and reasoning skills
 Strong interpersonal communication skills
 Ability to manage ambiguity
 Experience driving initiatives
 Advanced Excel skills (including pivot tables, vlookups, data modeling, etc.)


   Preferred Skills:
 

 Experience with ICM/SPM tools (Callidus, Anaplan, Xactly)
 M.B.A in Finance or related degree

Title: Analyst Billing & Collection
Description:
Posting End Date:
  July 25, 2022
 

   Employee Type:
  Regular-Full time
 

   Union/Non:
  This is a non-union position
 

   Are you interested in a great opportunity to learn about the services that Enbridge Gas provides to its largest commercial, industrial, storage and transportation customers? Are you looking to be part a dynamic team that will allow you to demonstrate your analytical and problem-solving skills while meeting our customers’ needs?
 


   We are looking for an Analyst Billing & Collection to join our team!
 

   As an Analyst Billing & Collection you will be responsible for the timely and accurate billing and collection of 1,600 accounts totaling ~$700M of receivables and ~$130M in remittances on a yearly basis.
 


   Apply today!
 


   What You Will Do:
 



     Analyze data and create invoices packages for large volume commercial, industrial, and storage and transportation customers.
   


     Enter and validate inputs into billing systems on a timely basis with high degree of accuracy.
   


     Main point of contact for internal and external customers to answer questions, resolve complaints and address payment related issues while maintaining positive relationships.
   


     Follow, document and identify improvements to processes and procedures
   


     Work with IT to identify & deliver system defects and improvements to internal systems.
   


     Create reports and data queries including providing data analysis as required.
   


     Identify, plan and implement projects that improve the departmental processes and systems.
   


     Assist with other tasks, as required, within the Large Volume Contracting & Policy group.
   



   Who You Are:
 

   You have the following education and experience:
 



     Related university degree or technical diploma with limited experience OR a combination of related certification and a minimum of 5 years directly related experience.
   


     Proficient to advanced knowledge of related office software; company databases; company structure and standard operating procedures; and/or office communications technology.
   


     Strong analytical skills with good attention to detail.
   


     Ability to work in a team environment with tight deadlines.
   


     Ability to learn new concepts and systems quickly.
   


     Experience in problem solving and process/procedure improvement.
   


     Excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills required.
   


     Digital literacy, proficient in Excel would be an asset.
   



   Working Conditions :
 

   Occasional overtime may be required
 


   Flex Work Clause
 

   Enbridge provides competitive workplace programs that differentiate us and offer flexibility to our team members. Enbridge’s FlexWork (Hybrid Work Model) offers eligible employees the opportunity to work variable daily schedules with a flexible start and end time, to opt for a compressed workweek schedule, and the option to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays. Role requirements determine your eligibility for each option or combination of options.
 

   #LI-Hybrid
 


   Diversity and inclusion are important to us. Enbridge is an
  


   Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer
  . We are committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to age, race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, veteran status, Indigenous/Native American status, or disability. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats, communication supports, or other accessibility assistance by contacting 
  
   careers@enbridge.com
  .
 


   Information For Applicants:
 

 Applications can be submitted via our online recruiting system only.
 We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.
 Final candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check.

Title: nCino Business System Analyst
Description:
Position Description:
Ready to join an outstanding culture that cares about diversity and inclusion, corporate social responsibility and gives the freedom to innovate, influence decisions, and chart an exciting career?  CGI is more than just an IT company. Be part of a team that supports the local community with the ability draw on global best-in-class talent! Benefits include a share purchase program, profit sharing, wellness credits, training and development programs, and flexible work schedules and locations.  CGI is seeking a nCino Business Systems Analyst to join our team!  In this role, you will work directly with both technical and business personnel across functional areas of the business. You will be responsible for the recommendation of automation solutions within Salesforce as well as third party tools. You will also work with a cross-functional team of IT and business resources to design solutions and work through the development and launch phases. Working with leaders across the business, you will collect requirements and present strategies for the implementation of new programs/initiatives, as well as the presentation of solutions. 


Your future duties and responsibilities:
This is an exciting time for CGI, and we want you to be part of it. We are Canada's largest independent information technology services firm, and we're still growing! We're expanding in Toronto Canada and we need your skills, enthusiasm, and dedication as part of our team.


Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate
5-7 years relevant experience.
Experience in Agile Methodology
Experience in nCino/Salesforce is mandatory for this role. Certifications are an asset.
Experience in platform integration is an asset
Experience in nCino, CRM, Sales Platform and applications – especially Salesforce Platform is an asset
Experience in the Financial industry is an asset
Advanced to Expert knowledge of system analysis process and techniques
Advanced to Expert knowledge of systems and applications supported by the team including system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows, and business rules
Advanced to Expert knowledge of enterprise technology delivery practices and standards and related expertise including design, development, testing and project management.
Advanced understanding of business supported
Works independently as the senior or lead system analyst and coaches/ guides members within area of expertise
Subject matter expert and consults with clients and/or project teams

 Skills:
  

Financial Services
Requirement Management
Requirements Analysis
Business Process Analysis
nCino



Skills:

Application Design
 Application Development
 Business Analysis
 Business Process Analysis
 Financial Services



What you can expect from us:
Insights you can act on  While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.   When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes.
